text: Veiled golden blonde with a nice compact white head, active crackling and superb laces. Floral aromas, hoppy citrus, grapefruit, malt and caramel. The taste is lively and fresh, perfumed with citrusy hop with floral and grassy notes, spices, caramel and fruity of lemon and its zest. Crispy bitterness and the beer is dry in finale.

On tap at Brickmasters, Vienna on 14-May-2017 served in a shaker. Hazy orange amber colour with a medium sized white head. Aroma of citrus, sweet fruit, malt and pine. Medium body and carbonation. Taste is orange marmalade, sweet fruit, grain and hops. Light bitterness with an alcohol buzz - a nice fruity hoppy pilsner.
Pours golden with whiteish head. Aroma is sweet, fruits, citrus, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, citrus, tangerines, grapefruit. Carbonation is high.
It lives up to its name as a hoppy lager with aromas of lemon, pine, orange peel and even a tiny bit of chocolate. Lots of hops and alcohol in the mouth. Fun to drink.
Flaska @ Biraria, Malmö. Disig guld/orange med ett stadigt vitt skum. Dofter av malt, karamell, gräs och citrus. Samma återkommer i smaken tillsammans med övermogen frukt. Fyllig kropp.
Вкусное пиво. Похоже на IIPA. Хороший вкус и приятны& аромат, а так же горькое продолж& хмелево& послевк&
Liten flaska. Disig gyllengul öl med ett vitt skum. Doft av gräs, hö och olika citrusfrukter. I smaken tillkommer viss maltighet. Bra komplex beska.
0,33 l. Bottle. Golden color with small white head. Herbal and hops aroma. Citrus, yeast and bittersweet taste. Easy to drink.
Hazy gold, moderate white head. Hoppy aroma. Medium body. Bittersweet taste. Honey malts and nice hops. Medium bitterness. Good-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle @ Fox and hounds, Aabenraa. Slightly unclear golden body with a small white head. Aroma is mild malt, citric fruit, oranges, spices and herbs. Flavor is soft malt, spicy, yeast and not so much bitterness. Would never have placed this as a pilsner in a blind test, not so easy to categorize, but very nice.

33 cl bottle bought at Mamá Cecilia, Alcalá de Henares, served in red wine glass. Pours completely hazy pale amber. The head is magnificent: enormous, tight and creamy, long-lasting and much lacing. Aroma is medium-high: bread, lemon, grapefruit, grass, honey, cookies, pie. Taste is dry, mildly fresh, not really fizzy. Quite bitter (even though well balanced) and long-lasting. Fly, yo!

Piwo chmielone na zimno bez przerwy przez okrągłe 60 min.  
 Data ważności:  08.2018 
 Kolor:  Złoty, piwo jest mętne. 
 Piana:  Biała piana na dwa palce.
Dość wiotka i niezbyt okazała.
Drobne ziarenka tylko przez krótką chwilę utrzymują się na powierzchni.
Na otarcie łez pozostaje całkiem fajny racing. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest mocno cytrusowy. Nie brakuje tutaj pomarańczy, limonek, cytryn, czy grejpfrutów.
W tle majaczy soczyste mango.
W oddali odrobina ciasteczek i słodów. 
 Smak:  W smaku początkowo słodowe z wyraźną chlebową i ciasteczkową bazą.
Po kilku łykach zaczyna dominować chmiel. Czuć wyraźnie wpływy amerykańskiej rewolucji piwnej.
Chmiele dają akcenty żywiczne, leśne, odrobinę ziemistych, ale przede wszystkim owocowe.
Dominuje mandarynka, pomarańcza, ananas, czy grejpfrut.
Jest też delikatna, ale zupełnie nieprzeszkadzająca maślana powłoka.
Goryczka jest długa, czysty chmielowy finisz.
Umiarkowana tekstura i spora pijalność. 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Kooperacyjne dzieło dwóch piwnych potęg: włoskiego Birra del Borgo i amerykańskiego Dogfish Head.

Średnio treściwe i średnio pełne piwo.
Słodowy charakter trunku zaznacza się już na początku degustacji.
Zostaje on szybko skontrowany atakiem amerykańskiego chmielu.
Delikatny diacetyl nie przeszkadza wcale w degustacji
W pełni udana kooperacja.

Flaska från SB. Provning med ölsällskapet. Blekgul med högt vitt skum. Rejält fruktiga humletoner i doften; gräsiga toner, grönt humle, citrus, ananas, mango. Känns mer som att sticka ner näsan i en snällare dubbel-IPA. Kroppen är något större, ganska len. I smaken mer gräsig, torr beska, lite örtiga inslag, honung. Torr och ganska aggressiv beska. Lite väl stor skillnad mellan doft och smak. Svårt att ringa in genren "imperial pils".
Hoppy, floral, bread and honey, golden with a good white head, light body, medium carbonation, again floral notes, alcohol is well hidden, quite dry....quite good.

Fruity and malty sweetness, some white icing sugar, sweet caramel and honey notes, light citric spices into the finish.
Just a touch of bitterness, with plenty of hops to accompany the taste. Citrus aroma, easy enough to drink. Has more character than pale lagers usually do.

0.33l bottle. Malty and hopy aroma, soury citruses notes. Hazy yellow color, white head. Malty and hopy taste, light soury notes, alcohol is hidden. Light to medium body, thin texture, soft carbonation and hopy bitter finish. Easydrinking, very good.

Blonde paille, faible carbo, collet moyen.
Arômes pain, abricot, herbeuse
Ronde, généreuse, belle amertume en finale. 
Bien équilibrée.

Aroma - a lot of herbal hops, malt, old yeasts, a bit of yellow fruits juice. Taste - mild and pleasant sweetly, with a lot of malt and yeasts, mild bitterness, herbal hops, a bit of yellow fruits and citrus pulp. Good and pleasant.

A little bit carameled, full body, very hopped, you can taste the dryhopping.Its a bit strong in alcohol, but you can drink a lot without even noticing the alcohol.But it is a string beer. Its a special pilsner more toasted.Salty
Pours hazy yellow with medium sized head. Aroma is citrus. Taste is bitter with hops and citrus. Pretty nice.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours a beautiful golden colour after a great pop like champagne, light foam that stays for a while. Smell of hops comes instantly. Taste is grass, hops, orange juice, slight wine gum. It is strong in alcohol but really you dont feel it, especially initially which is beautiful. The Abv and bitterness dont overpower the drink at all and it remains citrusy and a delight to drink (all too quickly). Delight.
Fľaa. Mútna tmavo zlatá farba, biela pena. Vôňa sladová, sladká, jemne citrus, kvasnice. Chuť sladká, citrusová, jemne kvasnicová. Dochuť horká, veľmi dlhá.
Découverte dans la Saveur Box. Bière blonde dorée. Fruitée avec finesse au nez. En bouche elle est douce et houblonnée. Au top comme toutes les bieres Del Borgo. Une très bonne dégustation.
Thats a bit of a good beer that is. Lovely aroma and a full soft mouthfeel over a bitterness that is in check to a light dry finish. Rich fruity enjoyable, I wish Id known Antonia.

Unclear yellow color, medium sized white head. Fresh aromas of grain, hop, citrus, yeast, orange peel, slight tart and vinous. Very neutral taste, but towards the finish you find lemon peel, crisp hops and a lingering bitterness.

2 finger white head, golden body. Nose: Elderflower, peach, oranges, grassy notes and lemon. Taste: Peach, elderflower, wheat, grassy notes, oranges, pineapple and caramel.
Semi-long bitter ending.
Bottle (2014). Poured a cloudy golden color with an averaged sized head. Straw, some fruitiness, floral, grains, and some earth.

Almost clear pale yellow with lots of thick white head. Delicious flowery and grassy fresh hoppy aroma with notes of citrus. The taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with the bitterness increasing in the quite hop aromatic finish. Really nice taste and it has a really nice prickly carbonation that suits the beer really well. Very well done I think.
Perfect pils. Nice bottle, nice colour and a very good taste. This is a perfect all year beer.
Bitter strong Pils with medium hoppy body. Some pepper in aroma and taste. This is a usual Pils just bit stronger and with more hop.

Very cloudy orange body, smooth white head. Great floral and subtle hoppy aroma with apricot, pine, honey and lemon. Surprisingly full body, decent carbonation, really sneaky alcohol content. Relatively dry, bitter flavour with grapefruit, honey, pine, a strong acidic finish with lime. Quite unique and interesting.
Bottle. Golden color, hazy liquid, white head. Higher carbonation. Taste more like ale than pilsener. Still good though, aroma of mango is dominant. Light bitter, hidden alcohol. Good.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, tropical fruit, grain, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Hazy/turbid yellow/golden beer with heavy yeast and with a medium white/off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel and tropical fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with grain, hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. What a great beer with loads of hop flavours. Even better if you see it as an Imperial Pilsener. Do not know what style I would consider it to be.

330ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Slightly hazy golden color. Small size, bubbly beige head, stays. Fruity, orange, sweet, yeasty in aroma. Mold, sweet, alcohol and mushrooms in taste. Fizzy and alcoholic aftertaste. Boozy mess.
Bottle (thanks fatphil). Pours golden with whiteish head. Aroma is sweet, fruits, citrus, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, citrus, tangerines, grapefruit. Carbonation is high. Overall: very good.
Floral en aroma, con notas de pan y fruta. Me gusta la presencia de levadura en boca.

0.33l bottle. Hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma: citrus, grass, yeast. Taste: fruity, citrus, solid malty, yeasty. Medium body, medium to lively carbonation. Higher bitterness accompanied by fruitiness, dry finish.

330 ml bottle. pours a hazy yellow-orange with a huge white head. Very intense hoppy aroma with herbs, pine, lemon and some notes of light malt. Medium body with soft carbonation. The taste is lightly sweet but dominated by a moderate to heavy bitterness. The flavor is, again, very hoppy, with tropical fruits, lemon, orange, kiwi, lychee in front of some biscuit malts in the background. Very enjoyable.
On tap. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma - Grain, citrus, wheat, spice. Taste - Medium bitterness, medium sweetness, elderflower, honey, orange, cereals. Smooth.
A citrusy , sharp aroma, it drinks clean, with a lot of yeast influence on the finish
Tap at 100 piv. Golden hazy color, thick white head. Aroma is citrusy, fruity, hoppy, light sour. Taste is fruity, light sour, medium hoppy, citrusy, zesty, hoppy
On tap at 100piv. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma of yeast, saison-like. Taste is sweet, medium bitter, malty, yeasty, herbal.

Bottle shared by happyhoppy - Color: clear golden blond beer with small carbonation and small creamy white foam. Smell: superb nose, floral and sweet malty. Bread notes, really nice balance. Taste: full body with great sweet/bread malt backbone. Really nice, really fresh. Floral good fruity balance with yeast and hops. Good attenuation. Aftertaste: sweet malt and bread, floral notes. Wet bitterness.

De aspecto dorado pálido y acompañada de una verdadera orgía de espuma blanca.

Aroma a cereal y lúpulo, sobre todo hierba y cítrico.

En boca es deliciosa, muy suave y agradable. Recorre varias fases, el dulzor de la malta, cítrico y lo que se me antojó manzanilla para terminar en un amargo muy personal (76 respetables IBUS) que para nada se hace desagradable. Su carga alcohólica tampoco se hace evidente en ningún momento. Entra como el agua.
From bottle. Hazy golden with small white head. Grain and citrus in the aroma. Light malty and moderate bitter taste. Good beer.
Keg @ Beergeek, Prague. Pours amber, white head. Nose is lemon and grapefruit. taste is as above with a big malt kick and big cheese hop kick, lovely.

Cloudy yellow, big strong white head.

Aroma: pils malt, some spicy alcohol, solid grassy and flowery hops.
Taste: light malt sweetness, moderate hop bitterness.
Malty body.
Flavour: malty, grassy, fresh lemon, flowers, honey.

Very good.

Looks like a (little hazy) pils with a rich white head. The aroma is typical of a IPA, hoppy and full of grepefruit, a little spiced too. In mouth is full bodied, sweet and malty with a nice bitter end. Despite the alcoholic content, the mid-low carbonation and the perfect balance between sweet and bitter make this a very drinkable and great beer.

Bottle 0.33l sample at Samo Pivo Belgrade, Serbia. 20.07.2016. Small tasting with Ogi and Vlada. Pour it hazy golden color with small white head. Aroma sweet caramel with yeasty twist. Taste sweet caramel, peach, apricot, pretty much yeasty smooth texture, nice balanced for this kind of style, medium body, creamy, lively, sweet finish.
Sample @ Voldby Ølfestival 2016. Pours clear golden with a big white head. Notes of grain, citrus, pale malt, hay.

After a bit of a Dogfish head session had to try the Italian version of this beer. A PILS in the 30minute IPA style and its been executed brilliantly. Honey on the pallet and a lovely rich character that destroys all ideas of what a PILS is and should be. Great beer!

Love this beer. Going commercial hasnt impacted this fantastic beer with a deep amber colour, and rich pallet that confuses the senses when your supposed to be drinking a PILS. Its loaded with flavour from start to finish.
Mi Piace!!! loving this imperial PILS with the 30minute hopping process. Big hop profile and so easy to drink
And this is a PILS!! Its huge with a resinous mouth feel that is big and rich and so easy to drink despite the high ABV. Will be back for more
Sample @ Voldby Ølfestival 2016. Golden pour with a huge frothy head. Notes of grains ,hay, citrus fruit, lemon zest, grassy and some light booze.
Farven er orange gul, med en hvid vedholdende skumkrone. Aromaen er citrusfrugter og noget græs, medens smagen er grape og krydderier med en varm afslutning.

0.75l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. A good looking one this. Almost a little glowing, quite cloudy and whats best described as straw-orange in color. It also has a good looking medium sized quite lacing white head. Smells really nice also. Wheaty with citrus and some sort of spices. Theres also a flower freshness detect here. Well hopped also, without being too much. Really like the way this smells. Well, its not as tasty as it smells. Pilsnerish and a little metallic. A nice oily mouthfeel and a just above average carbonation level. Mild metallic and its not hard to identify the alcohol here. Theres both peppermint and citrus in the tail here, making it quite interesting. Grows on you after a while, but this has probably seen better days as the bottle is quite old. 25.03.2015
Medium- full body, some grassiness and fruity hop notes. Decent bitterness. Good

[backlog] 10-07-16 / bottle at Bierbörse Mainz. Damn good pilsner. Fruity, well carbonated. Dont feel the high ABV. I started rating my beers with Untappd and a few basic notes. Now I want to rate them on ratebeer. So my rating sometimes lack some information. Just ignore it, it is for my personal statistics. Untappd-Rating 4.25/5
Cloudy yellow with a moderate white head. Citrus, flower hoppy, elderflower, sweet. Taste is quite the same, well balanced light bitter and sweet.

0,33l bottle from Merkur. My 400. rating. The bottle is an eyecatcher. The beer is a creamy, smooth, tasty, bittersweet delicacy. The high ABV is not noticeable. Perfectly balanced beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

fantastic. just realized i had the american version 5 years ago. wasnt quite sure what an "imperial pilsner" would taste like, but this one rocked. big fruity aroma, notes of berries. nice hoppy backing and sweet finish. damn good.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2016 Bottle at the Globe Hong Kong.
Appearance: Pours a cloudy yellow colour with medium to thick frothy white head that lasts quite long. Also leaves fair bit of lacing.
Aroma: Rich, complex and hoppy aromas of grapefruit, mango and citrus, with some lime, lemongrass, piney and wheat notes.
Taste: Light citrus sweetness and herbal bitterness with touch of piney and tangerine flavour. Some subtle malt flavour.
Palate: Medium body with rich creamy texture. Light bitter citrus and herbal aftertaste with light carbonation.
Overall: A richer, hoppier and more complex imperial pilsner, yet still retains the refreshens and easy-going character of a pilsner.  The larger yeast gives a clean depth to the malt and yeast, allowing the floral hops to play the big role. And the bottle goes well with the beer too.

Hoppy, hoppy, hoppy. Great imperial top. Slightly cloudy, yellow. Oils and malt, transatlantic integration. Average carbonation, small champagne bubbles. Medium body, alcohol noticeable. Really good noble unfiltered beer.
Bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with nice thick white head. Aroma is orange, yeast. Taste is malt, orange, yeast. Quite yeasty and odd.

33cl bottle. Pale yellow with a fine-grained white head with good retention and a bit of floating white sedimentation. Smells like citrus, passion fruit, honey, elderflowers, grapefruit and floral hops. The taste follows the same notes, bitter-sweet and well balanced. Medium to light body, medium carbonation and a spicy bitter-sweet aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2016 Bottle. Pours almost clear golden with lazing white head. Aroma is hoppy with citrus, not much malt coming through, but pleasant with a hint of alcohol. Taste is light malty, light fruity, hoppy with grass and citrus. Finish is balanced, pleasant with distinct bitterness.

Bottle sample tasted at BBF Lab Madrid 2016 on the 02/07/2016. Hazy loght golden colour with a medium foamy white head. Aroma of malts, cereals, hops and hay. Taste is refreshing, citrus, hay and some bread. Next one please!

Fruity and fresh aroma. Fruity taste with very small amounts of alcohol. Heavy bitterness that fills the upper part of the tongue forever. A tasty strong beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Dangerous beer balanced and refreshing real treat. Hops also not too much. Nice foam and lovely aroma what else there is in the beer!
Golden bit hazy with medium white head. Malty aroma with bitter hoppy notes. Semidry bitterness followed by some sweetsourness. Some malty notes. Sweet malty aftertaste with hoppy bitter notes.

33cl bottiglietta bb06/2017, downed post-Emma tasting, ben tenebrata. - Bref: spectactularly on-point IIPL (Imperial India Pale Lager, scusatemi la parola) dry yet vibrant with cleanly dialed in and edgy Saaz and deep-furrowing US alpha acid exotics. - Cloudy yellowish pour, thin Kellerbier. Lemongrass stalk, lime and a minor whiff of abv through the clean bottom-fermentation. Really shines n taste: thin and cripsy as a mineral TUC cracker in malt base, slathered with pore-opening edgy aroma hops bringing all kinds of lively herbal, hedgerow and deep citrus (actual grapefruit pith) rind hops to the unsuspecting synapses, lingering Nd probing deeply for luscious pleasure. Thick with hop oils on a thin malt base = high art meets precision engineering. An elegant case for transatlantic collaborations if there ever was one. Glad to down this bottle tutto da solo.

33cl bottle: Orange blonde color. Sweet grainy aroma. Floral and perfumey flavor with plenty of sweetness and bready malt and cereal complexity. Rich and creamy mouthfeel, still finishes dry. Interesting and tasty beer, if you like bockbier check it out.

Pours hazy yellow with medium white head. Nose is citrus and flowers. Aromas are sweet malts, citrus, honey and spices. Average carbonation, medium body. Long spicy and citrusy finish. Elegant and complex beer.
Really nice strong lager, herbal grassy hops, moderate bitterness, light sweetness. Enjoyable refreshing brew
Interesting herbal hops. Honey herbal summer in the bottle. Very nice beer, bit off balance withxsweeteness

Très originale bière italienne qui surprend au nez par la complexité de ses arômes. Un nez puissant dagrumes, pamplemousse, citron, mais aussi une dominante dépices, dherbes séchés. Vraiment original ! La bouche est ample avec une magnifique amertume qui invite à la dégustation. La finale suit dans le même style : agrumes et herbes séchés. Très surprenante : une belle personnalité.

A 330ml bottle with a best before date of October 2016 and poured into a Mikkeller pint glass. It poured a hazy golden orange colour with a two finger slightly off white head that had great retention and left thick sticky lacing. Aromas of citrus lemon and orange, some pineapple and a hint of grass and herbs. Tastes of sweet honey, lemon and orange with a hint of grapefruit and herbal bitterness. Medium bodied with light carbonation. Overall this was a great and refreshing Pilsner. Aromas were a bit weak but it looks and tastes good.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2016 Ottima pilsener, si presenta con un bel colore giallo pallido, una schiuma compatta che lascia un buon lacing ed un profumo erbaceo penetrante. In bocca apre il luppolo, seguito da note fruttate e chiude sempre l?erbaceo che lascia un buon finale. Corpo leggero, bassa carbonazione. Provata alla spina presso birreria Gino

Birra veramente molto buona e ben fatta. Colore giallo un po torbido, con bella schiuma. Al naso sentori un po caramellati, ma soprattutto fruttati e un po erbacei. In bocca è sensuale. Fruttata, soprattutto melone, ma anche speziata e un po di caramello, con un finale sullerbaceo, tendente allamaro ma assolutamente non troppo. Ottimo lavoro!
Bottle. Hazy, amber, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, & bitter finish.

Közepes, nagyon tartós hab, homályos világos borostyán szín. Citrusos, komlós illat. Komoly keserű, édes, citrusos - trópusi gyümölcsös beütéssel, picike gyantával. Igazi ízorgia. Utóíze a korty folytatása és sokáig tart. Testes sör.
Pours a deep golden yellow. Nice aromas of hops/citrus/peppery. Nice hoppy flavor, spicy/pepper, alcohol shows up in the back end.

Bottled @ Enzios, Hornstull. Hazy bright golden, frothy long lasting white head. Fruity aroma, apricot, ripe orange and bread. Smooth mid-dry mouthfeel. Fruity almost juicy taste, pineapple, apricot, biscuits. Warming finish.
Beautiful cloudy golden appearance with some creamy head. Tastes of hops, citrus, grass and some smoke. Medium-heavy body, very good carbonation and a finish of fresh hops. Strong and refreshing

0,33lt bottle @ Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe, Volos, Greece
Well it didnt work for me. The aroma was not bad, sweet/hoppy. Appearance was very pale, soft white head, medium carbonation. The taste was very sweet and the aftertaste a bit sour and something between sweet sour bitter, unpleasant. Maybe something get wrong with that bottle, maybe it is not meant to get drunk by me.

duft: appelsin frisk sødlig
smag: meget blid super let drikkelig med lidt citrus og orange smag

Fruity aroma, hints of bubblegum and flowers. Pours pale and hazy with a frothy head. Taste of grapefruit with an after taste of bitter melon. Light bodied, thin, average carbonation. Quite long. Refreshing beer.
Bottle, Beerlovers Vienna. Malty aroma, golden color, not filtered. Intensive taste, bit bitter, note of a lager but has a lot more. Bitter finish, mild carbonation, pleasant on a tongue.

Bottle sample at a tasting, thanks Ariel. Hazy yellow. Aroma of honey, floral, oxidized with notes of wet paper. Sweet-bitter, oxidized, flavors of honey and fruits, cannot feel any hops. Medium-bodied, syrupy texture. Too old?

Bottle form Hops & Malt Dornbirn. Strong, hoppy and fruity indeed, but clearly with a different backbone and less sweet than any pale ale would be. The refreshing crispness of a good lager is still noticeable, but less predominant due to overall heaviness. Nice!

Bottle sample at a tasting at Tom L place. Thanks Ariel. Hazy yellow with white head. Aroma of citrus, honey and herbs, very fruity. Very sweet flavor, bitterish, quite alcoholic with notes of honey, some fruitiness and citrusy hops. Medium-bodied. Hard to drink.

Dorata con un'abbondante schiuma bianca persistente e compatta. Esprime al naso sentori di uva spina, miele di acacia e note di pane fragrante. In bocca è calda ed avvolgente con un amaro deciso, ma mai in evidenza rispetto al tono maltato. Una birra attenuata alla perfezione con un finale secco e leggermente balsamico di resine dolci.

Shared 11.1 oz. bottle. Pours a hazy light gold with a white head. Aroma is citrus and hay with some floral notes. Taste is pils malt, lemon, mild citrus, and grass. Fairly sweet with mild bitterness. Decent.

Aroma: light, sweet, IPA-like; Appearance: hazy pale straw with white head that lingers; Taste: also light and sweet; crisp; Palate: light bodied with finish that turns slightly bitter/hoppy; Overall: too sweet for me, but slight hoppiness saves it; might buy again.

(bottle, 33cl) Cloudy, pale golden colour with a big and firm foamy white head. Slightly yeasty, lemony and slightly grassy and resiny hoppy aroma with a touch of resin, accompanied by a mildly doughy malty background, including hints of white bread and a whiff of alcohol. Moderately bitter and slightly sweet flavour, medium to full bodied with a soft carbonation. Dry-ish (cara-)malty base with drying hops character, including resiny, grassy and moderately fruity notes of citrus, lemon and grapefruit, lingering into the moderately bitter finish with a mild but balanced malty counterpart. Pleasant. 02.III.16
un must drink di birrificio del borgo, luppolatura spietatissima(leggenda vuole che luppolino ogni minuto)
Sweet and high powered; hard to get the grainy pilsner traits but they are there. Sweet mineral finish.

From bottle in pilsner glass. Poured with billowing head and straw yellow body. Taste was dominated by lemon tartness with an almost soapy finish, nothing like other comments. Im sure this was past its prime and need to revisit/rerate in future.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2016 In bottiglia. Colore giallo leggermente scuro, con un abbondante schiuma bianca da soapy a cremosa, di media persistenza. Naso piacevolmente luppolato, leggermente fruttato, malto e granaglie. Carbonazione da soffice a media. Ottimo aroma di luppolo, intenso e robusto (sensazione di bere una IPA), molto soddisfacente, poi i classici stilemi pils, qui particolarmente fragranti, malto, lievito, granaglie fresche. Carattere complesso che si compone altresì di note fruttate duva, spezie e lontana impressione di resina dolce. Il Gusto è amaro, mediamente secco, fruttato fresco di luppolo, leggermente piccato e frizzante sul palato. Alcool presente, corpo pieno. Una imperial pils eccezionale, complessa ma equilibrata, dissetante e di estrema scorrevolezza nonostante il corpo robusto e pienamente luppolato.

7.5%ABV. Imperial IPA. 

Poured out a cloudy gold. 6ºSRM.

Nose has some subdued citrus freshness.

Mouthfeel is soapy. Carbonation is adequate. The palate is dominated by honey, mead, corn syrup, taffy, cotton candy, peach nectar, apricots, The palate is the thing that really sets this one apart with it being light, sugary, yet being hefty at the same time with some real malt backbone describing caramel, malted milkshakes and wheat bread. That palate of light sweetness and aggressive hops is unique!

Hops are pine, resin and sappy. Grassy and vegetal. Gentle hyssop and raw kale with some Brussel sprout.

Bottle. Cloudy golden-orange colour with big white foam. Aroma is floral and fruity, hops, citrus fruits, very fresh. Taste: malts, summer fruits, lots of hops and yeast. Dry finish. Medium body, medium to high carbonation. Very nice!

1/3 pint at BeeRoma 2015 (short rating, overall impressions only). Lovely aroma, fresh and hoppy. Slightly nutty in the background with some yeast esters influence and a tiny alchool presence. Zingy and light, it drinks way lighter than the actual ABV. Solid.

Bottle. Pours a golden orangey yellow with a small, large-bubbled head. Aroma is some pine, light citrus. Taste is soapy, some pine, more pine, light ethanol and pith. Full with medium carbonation. Decent.

From 0,33l bottle, Pours beautiful smooth deep cloudy pale to golden liquid, big frothy creamy white head, Aroma: very hopy, bit fruity (from hops), exotic fruits, oranges, resin, bit malty, Taste: light to medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter, light to medium sour, very hopy, yeasty, resin, exotic fruits, red fruits/ berries, all supported but a solid malty backbone, minor warming alcohol - still very well hidden, very good balance, extremely drinkable, Palate: medium body, creamy texture, soft to average carbonation, long bitter resiny finish. Overall: excelent brew, hopzy, fruity, ballanced, powerfull yet very drinkable, enjoyed!

@Wijnhandel Wielinga, 058. Schenkt bleek helder geel/gouden met schuimige witte kraag. Aroma is hoppig, citrus, fris en fruitig. Smaken zijn direct al bij de eerste slok wat vol/zacht/romig, tevens redelijk zoet, matig bitter, sterk, redelijk fruitig van sinaasappel en citrus, pilsmouten, exotisch, matige gekruid, hier zit iets te weinig koolzuur in daardoor proeft hij denk ik wat voller. medium body, iets qua IPA-achtige blond bier.. verder prima
, bread, cereal, grass, resin, golden, hazy, white foam, rocky head, medium sweetness, very bitter, oily feel, average carbonation, bitter, long finish.
Citrus, fruits, floral notes, mango, grassy hops. Flavour is moderate sweet with a moderate to medium bitter finish. Excellent hoppy Pilsner.

Draught at Mels Craft Beers, Vienna.
Deep golden, hazy body, with a big, creamy, stable, lacing, white head.
Aroma of ripe fruits, grass, peach, some berries, bread, sweet malts.
Lovely taste of ripe fruits, peach, lots of citrus, grass, candy, some bread.
Full, oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes bitter, quite dry, grassy, zesty, fruity.

Tasty. Pretty unique for this style, loads of lovely hops, with an interesting ripe fruit character. The Pils part of the beer just dominates in the finish. Overall one of the best Imperial Pilsners Ive had.

Davvero i miei complimenti...ho bevuto molte imperial pils alcune anche di casa mikkeller...ma questa my Antonia come birra le supera tutte...birra straordinariamente equilibrata per il genere a cui appartiene...non manca però di carattere i sapori dei malti si sentono tutti bella schiumosa alcool percepibile ma mai fastidioso bilanciato benissimo dallAmaro...mi ha molto colpito come birra

Bottle brought back from Rome and enjoyed in UK. Pours an attracttive light golden orange colour with a lasting white head. Aroma of citrus and very well hopped, with hints of caramel. Light sweetness, with a good level of hoppy bitterness. Medium body, texture just a little oily. Average carbonation, long bitter finish. Enjoyed this beer.

Clear golden colour with a medium frothy white head and good lacings. Aromas of tropical fruit like pineapple and mango dominate, notes of caramel, ripe peach and some spruce develop. Light livelyness fades quickly into a slick texture and a medium-full body. Fruity malt centered sweetness fades quickly into a pronounced tropical fruit induced hop bitterness. Overall well balanced but yet showing some light astringent hit. Lasting finish.
Bottle 33cl @ Danilo. Pours hazy golden colour, white head. Straw, hops, grass, fruits in the aroma. Heavy, straw, hay flavor.

33 cl bottle @ hotel room, Rome.
Pours golden color with a large head. Sweet starchy notes on the nose, mild sweet fruits and malts, some herbal hops. Sweet toffee and starch on the flavor, hay and pale malts. Slick palate. Alcohol comes through. Not very pleasant.
4423

33 cl bottle @ hotel room, Rome. BBE 10/2016
Aroma is heavy and sweet with exotic fruits and ripe apricot. Feels somewhat musty. Flavour has corn, cereal, grassy hops, some fruits and alcohol. Finishes with strong grassy hops. Heavy stuff.

The aroma is straight up catpiss on newly cut grass, Im not kidding you, but thats not always a bad thing. Thats just the hops over-dominating. Also a variety of sweet citrus, oranges, tangerines and a slightly herbal touch. The mouthfeel is a bit soft and theres not a lot of carbonation - once again I think about oranges and lemon peels, but theres a sweetness in here, almost like honey breaking through. Very clean malts. There is a slight spicy tone breaking through in the end? This beer is just like taking a bicycle ride in the evening down to an Italian restaurant in late August when all the fruit orchards are beginning to fade. The air is kind of "thick" from overripe fruits and a supressing, almost moisty heat and there is a thunderstorm around the corner.

Draught at Irreale, Madrid, 8.3.2015. Cloudy blond-gold with a white head. Crisp hoppy aroma, freshly cut grass and citrus. Very bitter, a little citrus juice and tartness. Medium body, very easy to drink, bitter citrus finish. Good.

Keg at CBC, thanks to Ian for the share. Cloudy vibrant orange yellow, big foamy white head. Looks great. Aroma is sweet peach, nectarine, dried apricot. Body is medium, foamy, tingly carbonation. Taste is lemon, grapefruit, peach schnapps, dry resin, crisp finish. Drinks like a DIPA rather than imperial pils. Good.
On tap at Craft Clerkenwell. Cloudy dirty gold colour lasting cream head. Quite full in the mouth. Some decent hop. Doesnt taste its strength good. Tasty.

Keg at Beergeek. I was trepadatious but Jirka was on the money with this one. Imperial Pilsners in my experience have been heavy, over-sweet jakey-juice but this one was delicious. A clean lager base is a fine canvas for hops. The beer is clear Gold with a White head. Nice tropical hop flavour. Pineapple cubes. A lovely dewy sweetness. This was a treat.

Bottles from Coppers, Newcastle and Buon Vino, Settle. Hazy yellow in colour, pouring with a large foamy head. Spicy citrus fruity flavours and tropical fruit notes are followed by floral fruit, pineappe and a bitter pine, warming finish.
Mix between summer ale and session APA. Lots of citrus scents and flavors. Nice for a sunny day alternative to a more heavy ipa.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Pours a hazy dark yellow body with a large creamy off-white head. Nose is grassy herbal tones, citrus, lemon zest and hints of grains, straw and lime. Taste is citric peel, lemon zest, grape peel and hints of grains, pale malts and straw. Medium body, high carbonation. Pretty intensely citrusy and hoppy, which works in a weird way. Was probably a lot better when fresh; this one has been forgotten in our cellar for half a year to a year more than it should have been.

Bottle shared with BBGTC. Pours a very hazy golden with a medium white top. Aroma is floral with malts and grass. Taste is fairly bitter with notes of citrus, grass and resin. Medium to full body and avg co2 levels. (Bottle passed best before date by 6 months)

Pours a strange brown-ish golden with a medium-high offwhite head that keaves great lacing. Nose carries strong dill aromas along with some olives, odd to say the least. Taste is american barleywine-ish, moderately sweet with massive hops and a lot of alcohol. Again the weird dill-y hops make an appeareance (sorachi ace?). Some sweet belgian strong ale impressions, too. Alcohol dries the mouth quite a bit. Body is medium and so was carbonation. Overall I must say that Im not a fan... I would get rid of these hops and use some better ones I believe. Man that was awkward.

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.

Bottle. Pours is hazy golden with thick white head. Aroma is malts, floral, herbal, citrusy, spicy, coriander. Taste is hoppy bitter, medium sweet. At first it felt like very fresh beer, not really surprising, but after while i was surprised by bitter and booze kick. Warm feeling. Full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Nice, long bitter finish.
On tap at Biercab. Golden colour with white head. Grass, citric, grape, tropical fruits aroma. Sweet, grass, malt, grape, citric and tropical fruits taste. Bitter. Medium body.
Hazy orange color with small head. Aroma is slightly hoppy and sweet malts. Taste is again bittersweet, grainy and malty. Tangerines! Super-soft and balanced. Not bad for a Pilsner!
Tap @mutenye Bologna dovrebbe essere una bassa fermentazione manca della pulizia e fragranza e limpidezza. Una buona Apa

A quite murky, yellow, calmly bubbling beer with a dense, medium and blond head. Aroma is strongly citrusfruity, grapefruits and mandarin, some pure grain. The great aroma. Taste has rich and smooth grain, grapefruits and mandarin, medium bitterness is citrusfruity with a twist of grass. Almost full bodied, very smooth. Velvety palate and citrusfruity flavours. The glass is empty too soon. The great beer.
hazy golden organe color with a citrus/grapefruit aroma... sweet and fruity taste... well balanced

Pale and murky golden color with a white head, medium duration and nice lacework. Aroma has notes of citrus, mild malty notes and resins. Flavor is bittery, with good duration, citrus, grapefruit and pine. Medium bitterness in the final with resins hops.
Very light aroma, strong head, surprisingly creamy on the pallet with a sweet and sweaty finish. More hop in the aroma than the pallet.

Prodotta dal laziale Birra del Borgo. Una birra molto interessante sullo stile delle pale ale, 7.5% che si fa sentire, colore arancio torbido, schiuma e frizzantezza nella media, odore di erbe e fiori, un sapore particolarmente amaro, soprattutto nel finale, dato dal luppolo, che però si intona molto bene col resto della birra. Da provare.
Hazy golden colour. Cirtus grass hop aroma and flavour, bitter finish, nice pilsner

330ml bottle at home, from AleselA, Glasgow - clear amber brown, lot of tiny bubbles, thin off-white head, grassy, fruity, citrus aroma, no lacing, viscous, grassy, hoppy, high carbonation, well balanced

It pours from the bottle with a cloudy, muted, orange-yellow color and is topped by a giant, dense, foamy head. The aroma has a decent yeast presence, some dull, earthy/leafy hops, a little bit of bready sweetness, and a tiny hint of alcohol. The flavor has a nice contrast of dense, woodsy bitterness against a chewy, yeasty breadiness. The light carbonation allows a mouth-filling, resinous texture to develop. Overall, this one is a bit hefty, with a rustic and bold flavor profile that is quite satisfying.

Bottle @ home. Pours a hay-colored hazy liquid with a tall and lasting white head with quite of lot of lacing. Dry and a bit sweet aroma of pine apple, hop resins, mango, orange, candy & grass,. Toast, honey and sugar. Quite light bodied with smooth carbonation. Taste is dry and bitter with a really nice juicy pine apple character up front. Also oranges & mango, light maltiness, honey & toast. Some background grassy notes and grapefruit in mid-taste. Dry finish with some honey sweetness & grain lingering, resinous, assertive and lasting grape-bitterness.
I am not a huge pils fan but this is quite nice. The individual scores I gave are not a totally accurate picture of this beer. Very well balanced and light. Clean but not too clean finish.
Aroma of citrus, fruits, floral notes, mango, grassy hops. Flavour is moderate sweet with a moderate to medium bitter finish. Excellent hoppy Pilsner.
Genialne !! Piękny zapach. Genialna drobna piana. Goryczka nieduża na początku, ale po chwili przychodzi wyczuwalna, długo utrzymująca się i kompletnie nie męcząca !! Polecam
Bottle at home. Pours hazy yellow, nose is zesty citrus fruit, taste is sweet, pine, juicy.

Bottle. Golden, white head. Nice grassy aroma of fresh hops and citra. Taste is bitter and fresh, with citra and grain. Quite a lot of carbo. Good hoppy lager, but a thicker top fermented body could benefit the beer.
Another good one from Birra del Borgo. Crisp and refreshing with some bite.

Although I really enjoyed the Dogfish brew, this one has its own merits. Malty, as is the norm for the style, without being overly grainy or sweet. Nice body without the chalky dryness of the usual Italian hard water.
like a double IPA with pilsner malt backbone. american hops much more noticeable than saaz. Not what I imagined an imperial pilsner to be like but very nice nonetheless.

yellow / orange, hazy color. tiny head. smells fruity, fresh, light yeast aroma, smells of strawberry and mango. full bodied, tastes woodland strawberry, grapefruit, light mango, very subtle bitterness. palate is lacking a bit for me, could be a bit more complex. overall good though.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma of hops, citrus and some malts. Pours dark orange with a rich white head. Tatse is slightly bitter with hops and sweet malts. Palate lingers to the mouth. Overall an okay beer, but definitely no blockbuster.

Alla spina presso abc roma. Ottima birra,amara ma non fruttata. Nonostante lalta gradazione è abbastanza beverina. Carbonazione media (key keg) e schiuma fine e persistente. Molto buona la consiglio.

Bottled:Hazy golden with a large and thick head.Aroma is hops, lemons, dough and some yeast.Taste is, hops, pine needles, grapefruit and some alcohol. Long, growing bitterness.

Zo, dan blijkt dat die Italianen ook heerlijke biertjes kunnen maken. Deze Is erg fruitig en zoetig met een milde grapefruit bitter, maar niet zo erg als al die andere extra hop biertjes die er vaak meteen weer in doorslaan. Mooie balans. Fris en fruitig. Heerlijk zomer biertje.

From tap at Open Baladin, Rome. Hazy golden color with off white head. Hoppy aroma, floral, citrusy fruity, malty and yeasty. Taste is sweet and bitter, mostly hoppy, floral notes, refreshing. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Hazy golden to yellow color, white head. Peach nose, passion fruit, resin, floral notes, hints of citrus and caramel. Grapefruit taste, peach, resin, light malty, moderate bitterness. Medium body, soft carbonation, creamy texture.

Flaske, 75 cl. Mørk ravfarvet med et hvidt skum. Ser godt ud, men er mest klister-sød, fra næsen til munden. Krydderkage og honning er de mest markante noter. Malten er i fokus (det er jo en italiener). Ikke nær så vellykket som Dogfish Heads version. Den røg sgu i vasken...
Small bottle @ La Tana, Brussel. Hazy yellow colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Light malty with fruity citrus notes and some honey. Easy drinkable. Bitter finish. Very good pils!
Tåkete gul farge med hvitt skum. Lukter fruktig, humlearomatisk, noe sitrus og appelsinskall. God bitter avslutning. Medium fylde.
On tap at Whats Brewing 2014, Stavanger. Pours hazy orange. Aroma of orange and grapefruit. Good balance of bitterness and sweetness, but at the egde of being too sweet. Some malt and grains.

Good grapefruity, resinous fruity aroma. Golden colour, dense white head, lacing, big bite, mid-sweet ABV noticable. Medium body, soft carbonation, bitter and grassy finish.

Bottle. Appearance is golden, pretty clear, one finger white head which leaves lacing. Aroma is fruity and hoppy, pine hints, some malt undertones. Taste is full and fruity, oranges and tropical fruit, not much bitterness, or carbonation, juicy, a bit of lemon. Tasty.

Dit bier heeft een mooie gelaagdheid. Eerste is hij wat bitter met citrusinvloeden, daarna volgt een romige laag met tropisch fruit. In de afdronk komt weer een klein bittertje terug met een zoete finish. Prachtig bier!

A bit hazy dark gold with a small white head. A bit sweet with tropical fruit, hay, honey and some alcohol. The finish was dry. An ok one.

Flaska från SB. Dimmigt lusbrun färg. Doft av mango. Fruktig smak med stor beska. Söt med lite för mycket beska.

@ Nedre Mölla 15/10-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Fruity, hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, green apples. Taste: Fruity, hoppy, caramel, sweet, grapefruit, peach. Body is medium to light full, the finish is dry, bitter and hoppy with notes of caramel and green apples.

@ Havregatan 141015. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget (34:-). Fruity and hoppy with a light caramely flavor, grapefruity and peachy, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and hoppy with notes of green apples. Well balanced.

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Cloudy golden, rich creamy head. Potent aroma of peach, tangerine and brandy. Sweet and fruity with medium body and well rounded mouthfeel. Tropical fruits battle with peppery alcohol for attention Really bitter finish with some vodka heat and honey sweetness.

Pours hazy amber with medium white head. Aroma of mango, peach, honey, citrus, spices. Taste is sweet and fruity, loads of honey, slightly funky bitter finish. Body is medium full and smooth with soft carbonation.

330ml brown nicely designed bottle with embossed logo, and a uniquely shaped label. Appearance is cloudy amber with a small sized thick beige head with good retention, that left lacing on the glass.. Aroma of orange peels, grapefruit, mango and pineapple. Flavours of grapefruit, pineapple, orange peels, mango and pepper. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, smooth texture and average carbonation. Birra del Borgo My Antonia is an interesting quite unique brew, citrus and tropical fruits like an IPA, unexpected from a beer labeled Imperial Pils. Bärnstensfärgad grumlig med mellanstort vit skum. Mycket citrus/persika i både doft o smak. Persika dominerar smaken!

Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity and hoppy smell with citrus, tropical fruits, lime and peaches. Similar taste. Nice strong bitterness that lasts a while. Very nice beer, love the hop aroma and the malt base is just enough to lift it all.
Dimmig citron gul med ett snyggt vitt skum. Doft: Mycket ananas, burk persika, frukt kola, humle, mandarin. Stark 8:a. Smak: Burk persika, burk ananas, piggelin, frukt kola, mandarin.

Bottle from SB. Pours one finger of head. Nose is like an IPA, lots of hoppy citrus. Taste is dry, typically lager. Good, but too dry for me.
Bottle (33 cl) from Systembolaget. Clear golden, medium white head. Grainy, earthy malt aroma, herbal annd grassy hops. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness.

"its been too long since i had the other to compare this to the DFH version. This one was more expensive, and likely not as fresh. Still pretty hoppy, especially in the nose. Well made, certainly one of the best Imperial Pils Ive come across.
Very pilsner looking, golden yellow, not a lot of head. Aroma is big floral fruity hop. Bitter hoppy, dry. Good beer!

Aroma: Earthy (as in ground rather than funk), roasted (almost smoky) caramel, very malty,

Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of hops, tropical fruits, citrus, mango. Malty flavour, hops, light bitterness. Fruity finish, pine. Nice crisp, hoppy pilsener.(33cL bottle @ our Italian holiday home, Buonconvento)

Cukorkás-süteményesen édes és gyantás-akácvirágos illatok, pilzeni test gyümölcsmentes, vagy legalábbis kevéssé gyümölcsös IPA köntösbe burkolva. Éles és cikkázó ízjegyek, vibráló jellegű remekmű, mely minden bizonnyal az "imperial pilsner"-típus egyik mintapéldája lehet.

On tap @ Birre in Piazza Eataly , Milano. Ambrato carico, quasi aranciato, con schiuma beige fine, non molto persistente. UPDATED: OCT 26, 2014 8/30/2014 Bottle at home (batch LS225/11, best before 01/2014). Pours a hazy golden orange with a big head. 10/26/2014 Bottle at home (33cl, batch LS14414C, best before 06 2016) Pours hazy golden with a white head, less big than previously. Tap at Broders Terzo Vino Wine Bar in south Minneapolis. This is the Italian version of this beer. Hazy golden-yellow pour with a nice white head. Bready, a little spicy. This seems a little dryer than I remember the Dogfish Head version that I had from a bomber.

bottle, thanks to skykob for grabbing this at beergeek. quite a pale golden with a minimal but lasting head; tropical and citric aroma, some grapefruit; light-bodied, not much alcohol showing for an imperial pils, good hit of bitterness, slightly metallic; too bad czech breweries cant make stronger pilses like this

Collaboration with Dogfish Head, an imperial Pilsener, in other words: a strong lager with ambitions. Creamy, snow white head, clear golden blonde colour with orange glow. Sharp and not very inviting aroma of bread, lots of grassy hops, lemon peel, iron, black pepper, blue cheese and a weird, bit chemical smell of turpentine or something like that. Tastes fortunately a lot better, rounded, clean pale malts, lively and fascinating spicy notes, bit metallic, rather full body, firm and assertive, long herbal hop bitterness in the finish. Different and interesting.

T - Sweet grainy and pilsner malts, grapefruit, lemon, citrus, pine, grassy hops, resiny bitterness, lager yeast esters.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth with a dry and bitter finish.

D - Great balanced and hoppy imperial pilsner.

Pale, hazy  cloudy amber color crowned by a very white, fluffy and generous head. Hoppy, sweet aroma to fruits with a malty base of biscuit and caramel. Hoppy taste, well balanced, with some fruity notes (peach, lychee). Medium bodied, creamy texture and declining development, nice finish. Liked it a lot.

12.7 oz. bottle- Pours hazy golden with a huge pillowy white head that wants to stick around. Aroma is floral, mellow yet assertive hops, somewhat spicy. The taste is light and hoppy, floral, citrusy, not overly alcoholic which the style can be sometimes. Very nice, would love to compare this and the American version side by side.

375 ml bottle.  Date on it says 05 2014, must be a best by date.  Pours a clear golden orange color with a huge fluffy head that fades slowly, leaves a little lacing too.  Aroma is musty hops.  Citrus fruit, strawberries, grass, and a light champagne yeast scent.  Taste is impressive.  Intense musty hops mixed with citrus and red fruit.  Moderate sweetness balances nicely with the moderate bitterness.  Medium body.  High fluffy carbonation provides a slightly foamy mouthfeel but it bubbles away quickly like champagne.  Overall, very enjoyable and somewhat unique.

75 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy golden with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is crisp, citrusy hops as well as some caramel malt. Flavour is much like the aroma with a slightly bitter finish.

Big offwhite creamy lasting head.  Hazy deep yellow body.
Powerful resiny citric aroma with strawy malty notes.  Dry-sweet
resiny orangey taste with strawy toffee notes.  Mid-to-full body.
Mild, soft mouthfeel.  Dry resiny malty toffee aftertaste with
marzipan, candy, and citrus notes.  Really nice, and highly
drinkable.  (0.75l bottle, wine monopoly, web order.)

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Stovner( bu). Golden color, good foam. Intense hoppy aromas( grapefruit), some fruitiness and caramel in finish. Medium body & complexity. Good bitterness, well balanced. Very enjoyable

Imperial Pils fatta in collaborazione con il DogfishHead di Sam Calagione.
La parte floreale e di luppoli ne esalta il corpo un pò scarso o comunque più scarso del odore.
Bevuta in bottiglia.

bottle at home with daniel listening to great music.
Aroma: citrus,yeast,fresh
Apperance: Cloudy, nice colour. Golden haze.
Taste: Fresh, mild bitter, Fruity, With a bitter finish.
Palate: Pretty average.
Overall: Okay, but nothing special.

750 ml bottle, pours hazy orange with a large foamy head. Plenty of bready & caramel malts and a big grape & seville orange citrus hop profile, with some lemon zest thrown in. The aroma is great. Low carbonation for a pilsner, but this is more than a normal pilsner. Crisp, hoppy as hell, but still with a good balance. Very nice indeed.

750 ml bottle. Pours hazy orange with a gigantic pillowy cream-colored head; leaves some decorative lace. Aroma is citrusy, SweetTarts, bready. Taste is hop-forward, like a nice American Pale or a hoppy American craft pils. Mouthfeel is creamy, carbonation is fairly soft. Tasty.
January 2012. From bottle. Pours golden color with a white head. Lots of hops in this one with citrus and pine aromas. Long finish. An outstanding beer.

330ml bottle. Pours a cloudy golden color with a large three finger white head. Aroma is citrus hops and spicy/earthy hops, with a hint of malts. Taste is citrus hops, bready malts, wet grass, and an earthy bitter finish.
Light citrus and fruit nose. Palate follows suit. Lots of nice carbonation going On. Pilsner im not sure because hops seem pretty high. Very well done and unique.

Aroma concentrated at first. Took a minute to open up. Gives way to a nice  cereal nose with roasty notes, and subtle raisin. There are definite piney-hop notes as well.  The beer pours a hazy amber with a decent amber-hued head. The taste is great. Definite pine coming from the heavy hopping. Also subtle earth and spice notes. Spice is especially apparent on the finish. Nice carbonation with a surprisingly light body and an excellent bitter finish. All in all a world class example of the Imperial Pils style.
Pours a hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, citrus, floral notes and hops. Taste is light to medium sweet leading to a hoppy finish. Pretty good.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Lambertseter enjoyed at home
Orange hazy, big offwhite head. Smells of grapes, citrus zests, spices and malts. Moderate sweet, quite fruity for a lager, dry mouthfeel. Medium to heavy bitter, quite heavy on the resins .Very drinkable, quite different from the typical imperial pils which is a good thing. Good stuff
Kul glassflaske,fått i gave av naboen. Gyllen, ugjennomsiktig, myd skum, mye humlearoma,sitrus,furunål,malt. En utrolig god øl

as always, one hell of a nice bottle!

pours blonde, small white foam. verry hoppy, bitter taste. sugary, intence , expecialy for a lager!

750ml bottle. Cloudy golden colour with huge, frothy, fairly lasting, lacing, white head. Hoppy aroma has notes of grapefruit, citrus, resin. Taste is almost similar but more cautious with moderately sweet pale malty background.

75 cl. split with a number of people. Gorgeous Porto / Wine style Del Borgo bottle. I was a bit surprised to find out that the bottom of the bottle is flat and not hollow. A continuously dry-hopped pilsner. It has been a while since I bought a bottle of an Italian beer, a year or so I figure. I suppose that it was the DFH logo that pulled me over the line, DFH has not been good so far, they certainly have not been worth the effort. Very hazy orange / orange with a reasonably big white head. Heavy citrus nose, yeast, heavy zest, hoppy, flowers, grass, Taste is heavy citrus, continuously hoppy hazy with some grass, creamy due to quite a bit of yeast, light citrus zest, bitter floral, hazy flowers, touch grainy due to hopiness, Full yeast and hazy due to continuous hoppiness. Interesting pilsner / IIPA hybrid fair.

Tasted on 1/26/13 from a capped 375mL bottle purchased at Grand Cru. Pours murky dark orange with a massive, rocky off-white head that slowly recedes to very thick, rocky lace. The nose is some pale cereal malt with with plenty of tropical fruit and dank green hops. The flavor features fuller malt than the nose would have suggested, with some caramel and toffee, and the hops coming through with tons of tropical fruit and some nice green bitterness on the back of the palate. The body is medium with average, stinging carbonation, and a long tropical fruit and bitter hops finish. This drinks more like an IPA/IIPA than a lager.

Big bottle @ hotel room in Rome. Bought it at a supermarket, Carrefour. This is a great IPA. I had the beer before in a craft beer bar, so was surprised to find it in a mini market... Nice bitterness, lots of hop! Does give you a bit of a dry mouth. Makes you more thirsty!

Bottle @ Bruces birthday tasting. Cheers to Leighton(or Colin?) for the pour. The appearance is light gold with a medium white head. The aromas light husky grain, bread, some lemon rind and juicy melon fruit gums. The taste is golden syrup, slightly toasted malt. A bit of light white grape punch. Soft fruit sweetness. Active carbonation, pretty crisp and easy to drink. Overall, not bad.

Location/Date:Bottle on February 20th, 2013.
Appearance: Pours a clear orange. 
Aroma: Aroma of hop, faint spice, faint bready malt.
Taste: Medium bitterness, some orange, bready malt.
Palate:Medium light body, delicate light fizz.
Summary: My first Italy tick! A hoppy imperial pils is a really rare find. This is my second rating of My Antonia, as Ive had the DFH one numerous times but not for awhile.  A really nice beer, with a pretty solid hop profile yet the characterstics of pilsners in terms of the malt and lightness.
Bruces birthday tasting st the craft.  Cloudy orange with big white head. Piny grassy aroma some soap. Highly carbed.  Heather grassy hop.

Bottle:
Medium sized, airy and bit fluffy white head changes with regular speed into a unequal spread hilly islad lacings on top of a beautiful equally hazy layered darker yellow fluor orange colored beer.
Smell nice hoppy bouquet: hop, flowers, lemon, citrus, soap, hint of nettle, herbs, sweat and swimming pool.
Flavours are a nice mix of hops, bitter, citrus, flowers, flowers, some malts, creamy, floral bitter and creamy herby.

user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle from BrewDog Birmingham; murky amber pour, massive white frothy head, malt aroma with citrus hops, really taste the hops in this one really pleasant and fresh, heavy bitterness resiny mouthfeel.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden orange with frothy white head. Aromas of grassy and floral hops, citrus, sweet malts, and some spices. Flavors of light spices mixed in with a little sweat malts, nice amount of grassy and floral hops, bit of a caramel and fruit. Finishes dry and with some hop bitterness. Kind of a hybrid between a IPA and pilsner. Pretty solid.

Bottle at GBBF 2012, London. Pours clear, rich gold with a medium, bubbly white head. Some grassy hops in the nose, toast and pineapple. Big sweet flavor with grass, light pee, big melon and pineapple. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Lightly sticky finish, somewhat resinous, with lots of sugar, straw and tropical fruits. Nice.

Bottle from Brewdog shop. Thick orange color, white head. Strong bitter taste with spices, caramel, fruits, funky malts, citrus and earthy notes. Dry bitter finish with citrus. Easily enjoyable speciality brew with lots of attitude and uniqueness.

Bottle.  Pours hazy orangy straw colored with minimal off-white head.  Nose is very hoppy, with some pale funky malt and fruit notes.  Tastes tart, fruity, with a complex hop flavor and funky malt melding well together.

Yellow/orange color with a good white head. Floral hoppy aroma with a good base of malts.
More body than in a normal pils. Good drinkability and perfect combination between the malts and floral hops.
Impossible to guess the more than 7% of alcohol. Dry finish.

Thanks to brother Austin!  pours a hazy golden straw dull with fair white head.  Very sweet and honeysuckle and lavendar and the hops are well melded together.  It does have a quality like other italian beers that Ive had before.  Not sure what that is.  Maybe the water?  But this is one of the best imperial pils ive had.

Location: 37.5 cl bottle from Sparrow, 1/10/13


Aroma: It has a good amount of tropical fruit: peach, grapefruit, etc., with clean malts and other hops

Appearance: It pours a hazy orange color with a huge, milky head, and tons of sticky lace

Flavor: The taste is on the hoppy side as well, with a tropical sweetness, and a mid-plus hop feel

Palate: The body is on the full side, with a rich, creamy feel, average carbonation, and a dry finish

Overall Impression: 
I decided to drink this one back-to-back with the Dogfish version, and I was even more impressed by this one.  I has a really nice hop feel to it.  Really well done.  Its almost hard to believe that this is a Pils, its got an almost IPA-level of hops.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2015 From a 330ml bottle on 7/1/2013. Pours a very cloudy dark orange with a huge fluffy head. Has a pleasant aroma of musk lolly and honey with distinct floral and pollen notes. The flavour is big and impressive, with oodles of sweet apricot, peach and melon, a good dose of honey, and some tart lemon. Finishes with a firm, quite long, lingering hop bitterness. and a firm. The body is quite full and the texture slick. I had no idea what to expect from this, and found it to be a very pleasant surprise. This is a  lager that could quite easily pass for a very good IPA. A lovely drop. Rating 4.1.

Re-rate on 31/8/2015. Have been drinking this quite a bit of late. Just a wonderful, rich, buttery, beautifully balanced, delightful beer. My fave imperial pils to date.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2013 Bottles @ BrewDog & from A Tutta Birra, Milan. Hazy amber brown colour, massive foamy head. Strong flowery hoppy corn aroma. Citrus fruit malt & hop flavour. Very smooth & creamy. Hoppy aftertaste. A great lager.

31-DEC-2012, bottle @Henrik, from Fish & Beer.
Hazy golden, huge white fluffy head.
Hoppy aroma with exotic fruits. Taste is exotic hops, very fruity. Not overly dry. Finish is bitter and dry. Medium body and carbonation.
Very nice drink but far too expensive.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2015 Bottle. Hazy golden yellow with staying white head. Aroma is hoppy with notes of fruit, flowers, hay, saaz. Creamy mouthfeel, medium/full body, soft carbonation. Taste is flowery, bread, citrus, a little caramel. Long hoppy citrus aftertaste.

Bottle. Last beer of the year and a damn good one. Pours a clear golden color with a lovely, steady and creamy white head. Aroma is full of fruits, strawberry and peach. Very nice. Flavor is quite sweet and hoppy, nice balanced and incredible easy to drink. This is an awesome closure of the year.

Bottle at Cookie. Spicy and complex, a treat. Aroma of grain, nuts, butter, vanilla, almonds. Taste is sweet, with light sour and bitter notes, long length. Palate is creamy, and full bodied. Dark yellow, with a big frothy head.

pours a thick yellow/golden with a medium-large foamy head. smells of floral hops and citrus scents. tastes like some mild but tasty hops there, with citrus..orange peel balanced with a nice mild roasty/caramel finish
En botella. Color dorado medio turbia.espuma densa blanca.aromas citricos,lupuloso y floral.en boca equilibrada,amarga y gustosa.
Bottle. golden-orange colour with an off-white head. Aroma is citrus, hop, peaches, floral. Flavour is citrus, peaches, hop, pine, floral, orange, alcohol. Bitter finish. Nice/OK beer.

Bottle. Deep gold with a large white head. Aroma is floral and lemony with bread and caramel, tropical fruits, a little whiff of pepper. Medium bodied, just vaguely syrupy. Sweet with some bread, sugar, apricots, some mango and melon, then firm but by no means overpowering bitterness; citrus, floral and peppery notes all fade gracefully in a long finish. Liked this _much_ better than expected.

Darker yellow with decent lasting snowy white foam head. Aroma is decent hoppy, taste is nice bitter hops with some fruit tone, tickling in mouth. Nice bitter aftertaste, lasting. (Catania 201212)

750ml. bottle, that looks more a brandy or liquor bottle than a beer one. 
Hazy golden colour, big head with good retention. Smells of hops, exotic fruits (I think papaya), oranges, spices, floral notes. Medium body, good carbonation.
Taste is very bitter,spicy, maybe pepper, papaya, oranges, herbal notes and simply a hop beast. Dry and bitter finish, this is a great beer.

Sample pour, slightly hazed crisp yellow with fluffed white head. Nose is citrusy, sweeter, slight wheat, lemon grass. Flavor is light citrus, crisp malt, grassy, fairly clean. Lighter body, somewhat refreshing.
Pours golden orange with a HUGE head.  Smells sweet and yeasty.  Tastes light...some alcohol...but not much....a little citrus as well.  Palate is nice....somewhat tingly.

[ASPETTO] 			
oro carico, leggermente aranciato, velata			
[SCHIUMA]			
bianca, abbondante, fine e compatta con buona persistenza			
[OLFATTO]			
intensa, con evidenti note resinose di pino; rimuovendo il biccheire compaiono le note prettamente maltate, con profumi caramellati e quella sensazioni crispy tipiche delle pils; si aggiungono sentori di lievito e alcohol.			
[GUSTO]			
approccio decisamente dolce, caramello  e miele con una componente di malto evidente. Qualche sfumatura fruttata compare allorizzonte ma si perde in fretta con la crescita degli amaricanti della generosa luppolatura che fornisce più che altro sensazioni vegetali e resinose: nel finale raschiano un po la gola, forti anche di una alcolicità di tutto rispetto che aggiunge quel tocco pepato che eprdura nel retrogusto.			
[TEXTURE]			
corpo medio alto, molto consistente in bocca, carbonazione media e percezione alcolica evidente ma non invadente.			
[COMMENTO FINALE]			
mia prima imperial pils , ammettendo che questo termine abbia un reale significato. Di fatto, al di la della bassa fermentazione, ricorda molto una IPA, complice forse la luppulatura di chiaro stampo americano (Dogfish) : una base maltata consitente, che da corpo e consistenza con laiuto di una buona gradazione alcolica, su cui si poggia, decisa, una luppolatura dominante e di forte impatto. qualcosa di deverso da una IPA in relatà si nota, ma personalmente faccio fatica a definirne gli elementi. Concudendo: ottima! collaborazione proprio ben riuscita
Cloudy gold pour, big off white head. Floral, yeasty, citrus/lemon peel aroma.  Bready, piney flavour, malt, good bitterness and a long sweet finish. Really good.

Bottle. Golden with a large off-white foam. Aromas are caramel with spiced oranges. Yeasty with lemon sherbet. Floral, hoppy and clean. Flavours are sweet oranges with green pine. Very floral with sticky caramel. Some pineapple. Warming peppery alcohol on the finish.
Italian version . big bottle .. . deep gold .. a bit cloudy .. great foam, lacing is impressive too .. . smooth and light, flowery and touches of yeast .. . enjoyable stuff .. . . i lost a needle..

Cyrstal clear dark yellow pour with a large fluffy white head.  Aroma is spicy hops, grassy, slight malt sweetness on the nose.  Smells great.  Flavor is similarly spicy, green, grassy, very lightly bready and clean.  Some slight residual sweetness balances everything out nicely.  Excellent beer.

Bottle.Hazy yellow colour with large white head.Aroma is strong fruity with flavor of exotic fruits,hops and perfume,smooth but unbanlanced with lively fresh mouthfeels,high carbonation and slight note of yeast,but still overall a really good beer.
Smooth as silk ipa with lots of very sweet flavours to counteract all of the hops

12.7 ounce bottle. Hazy orange gold color topped by a massive bubbly white head. Citrusy floral hop aroma. Dry bitter hop flavor dominates the palate. Soft smooth creamy mouthfeel with a peppery toasted malt flavor. More citrus hops in finish and aftertaste.
Bottle, pours a nice bright yellow, a bit of yeast poured in. So it was a little cloudy, the flavour is nice, it is quite hoppy, the body is full. A good bitter finish. Overall, nice offering
A bit hazy for an imp pils. the aroma is a mix of american hops and diacetyl. oily mouthfeel with a bitter end. out of style but I like it.

33cl bottle.
Dorée/orangée, col épais collant voluptueux blanc cassé.
Arôme est houblonné, citronné,a grumes, pamplemousse et ananas. Le tout est assez doux rappelant le maïs.
Palais garde une influence certaine de DogFish, citronné et agrumes rappelant le côté West Coast, ce qui est pas mal pour une approche imp pils.
Palais est fruité, note d epin, citronné, houblon nobles, les malts de type pils avec une certaine douceur de grains sur la fin. Le tout reste épais avec encore ici ces agrumes donnant un fruité agréable rappelant pamplemousse et ananas.

Aroma strong fruit, tropical, sweet malts, slightly boozy. Amber with white head. Very unfiltered, opaque haze. Good lacing.  Taste is burly for a pilsner. Smooth and bright with citrus And a certain sweetness. Vy enjoyable. Mango, peach Are in there....

750ml bottle. Hazy honey amber with a deep clean white foam. The aroma is almost perfumey with some sweet caramel thrown into the mix.  Full in the mouth with the alcohol coming through quite strongly.

Bottle with Carla from Beermongers. Pours a lightly hazy orange/yellow with yellowy foam. Smells very hoppy with a hints of raisin. Tastes lightly sweet, not much to say about this other than it has much more hops and much more body than any pils Ive had.

12.7oz bottle.  Poured hazy peach with a dense whitish head.  The aroma picked up fresh pine, citrus, and resiny fruits over bready malts.. very interesting zesty bite to it.. I really enjoyed it.  The flavor found bitter orange peel and floral notes throughout, with a bit of related citrus sourness.. some pale and bready malts supported, but didnt play a major role.. finished with citrus sourness, some earthy yeast, and bitter floral notes.  Medium-bodied and quite sour and bitter on the palate.. very citrusy.. interesting stuff that Id gladly drink again (for much less than $11, though).

In short: A pleasant semi-sweet, yeasty, fruity, slightly spicy blonde ale.  Good.
How: From a bottle at Mondial De La Bière 2012
The look: Cloudy yellow-blond body topped by a medium white head with medium retention
In long: Nose is bright with some kind of spiced mandarine cocktail over a bed of flowers, very aromatic stuff here.  Taste is like chewing on a mix bag of dried fruits (dried little orange cubes, dried slices of bananas, dried apricots, more), some coriander-ish and ginger-ish spiciness, honeyed hay, dusty yeast, grassy and floral hops.  Strong yeast presence.   Yellowed grass in the finish almost dry out the beer.  Pleasant big fluffy mouthfeel with a lively carbonation.  A bit too sweet for my dryness-seeking palate but I found it nonetheless enjoyable.  Got a generous 6oz sample and can easily imagine myself drinking a lot more of this.  Another beer I had at Mondial 2012, I was using all my lunch breaks from work every day to go to Mondial and drink beer instead of having lunch, but dont you dare calling people like me a drunk (us drunks really hate that).
En botella.Rubia un poco turbia con fina espuma blanca.Aromas cítricos,cuerpo medio-alto,y final persistente y redondo.

Nice beer. Dark orange coloured and unclear. Has a white head, fully lasting. Aroma is heavy hoppy, harmonic. Herbs, faint grass, citrus and fruit too. Flavor is starting light sweet, finish heavy bitter. Dry, creamy texture, soft carbonation.
nice hoppy aroma,yellow,cloudy, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,

Nose shows floral, spicy and grassy hops along with a soft doughy yeast note, Belgian style.
Clean flavours, with some soft sweet malt and grassy and spicy hops. Also the faintest hint of alcohol.

15/VIII/2012 on tap @ Internationaal Streekbierenfestival (Zwevegem) - BB: n/a (2012-934) Thanks to Erwin for sharing all the beers together!
Clear orange beer, creamy white head, pretty stable, non adhesive. Aroma: cheesy, exotic fruits, bit sweet, ripe mango, passion fruit. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: exotic fruits, little sweet, pineapple, passion fruit, little grassy, citrus, bitter hops, grapefruit, bit piny. Aftertaste: grapefruit, piny bitterness, pineapple. A job well done!
Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.

A-- Poured a clear, golden straw color. Quite vibrant and shows nice life with small carbonation bubbles. Three finger bright white head that slowly dropped to half a finger of rocky head leaving lots of thick, soapy looking lacing. Looks even better when swirled. 

S-- Light notes of lemon grass and citrus but backing of sweet bread. Soft but quite vibrant nose. 

T-- Starts of clean and crisp and picks up quickly. Get sweet banana bread and a lot of citrus notes followed by citrus bitterness. 

M-- Highly carbonated and quite creamy. Lighter bodied, though it does get heavy as drinking on.. Lots of bitterness in the mid and back of the palate. Lots of notes of lemon, pine and grapefruit with good doses of sweet bread. ABV is noticeable in the mouth but still a very good feel to this. 

O-- Nice beer. Quite drinkable and a good palate changer. Good collaboration beer.

text: Bottle at GBBF 2012. Nose is clear golden, white head. Nose is grassy, straw, lots of grapefruit citrous. Taste is caramel, grapefruit, grainy. Really good for the style. Taste is caramel and grapefruit, raw alcohol, banana ester. Has a lager crispness and hop bite, but with loads more flavours and fruit than one would normally expect.
Hazy amber gold body with lasting head. Fruity aroma , sweet malt start with good long bitterness then in the taste.

mondial 2012, mtl - notes. hazy bright golden with a frothy white head, good retention and lacing. saaz, fruitiness, phenols, bready and crisp malts, warming alcohol - never boozy, medium hopping - light pine and citrus, nice bittering finish. average to soft carbonation, medium body.

Bottle, 75cl. An unclear, lighlty gushing, golden-orange beer with a finger-thick off-white head. Citrusy, sweetish aroma with peaches and some flowery hints. Not much of a pils or imperial pils, but a really nice one. 120804

Bottle 750ml @ Geokkjer
Pours slightly hazy golden with a huge white head. Aroma has notes of malt, pine, citrus and floral. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter. Body is full, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle.Pours cloudy golden with a big white head. Aroma of peachy hops, malt, fruitiness and floral hops. Flavor is sweet and hoppy with some fruitiness, peach and malt. Medium body, average carbonation. Really nice.

750 ml bottle. Cloudy amber colour. Medium-sized white creamy head that clings to the glass. Citrusy marmelade aromas. Clementine and bitter oranges. Complex caramelly flavours. Rich texture. Surprisingly complex. Well balanced. Smooth texture. Oily and velvety. Nice refreshing bitterness in the finish. Really nice beer. Italian in character and quite unlike any other imperial pilsener Ive tried, at least much more complex and vinous than the others.

Bottle. A medium to dark blonde beer, with a huge, frothy/creamy, lacing, almost fully lasting white head. The aroma is lightly malty (bread), moderately hoppy (grass, grapefruit, herbs), with notes of oranges, perfume, hint of other exotic fruits. The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, velvety texture, lively carbonation, dry, long finish with something more than a moderate bitterness, lightly alcoholic. Excellent, refined aroma, almost balsamic, interesting mix of noble and green hops, clean and assertive bitterness that never becomes sharp or abrasive.

Imperial Pils con el lupulizado típico de Dogfish Head fabricada en casa de los italianos Birra del Borgo, Presentación espectacular tanto en botella como servida en el vaso. Ottima pils trasparente e ben carbonata, coperta di una fine schiuma (un po poco persistente a dire il vero). Colab with DHF.

Taste is pretty bitter, with a whole lot of caramel sweetness to it. 
Medium body, with a semi-fizzy carb.

6/29/12. 375mL bottle. Slightly hazed golden pour with a small khaki head. Doughy and perfumey aroma with a bit of citrus. Slightly sweet malty flavor with definite pils malt amd bits of perfume amd citrus. Not bad!

Clear gold with a small head. Surprisingly hoppy aroma, smells more like an Ipa than a Pils. Tastes like an Ipa too (so much so that I had to double check with the bartender to make sure I got the right beer) nice palate.

[4476-20120608] Bottle. Fresh fruity apple pear aroma. Slightly hazy, brown orange body with a medium-lasting creamy off-white head and some lacing. Toasted mandarin hops flavour has the feel of peppermint in the finish. Medium body. Tasty. (7/3/8/4/15) 3.7
