@Mondial de la Bière 2012, Montreal - hazy dark amber beer, nice foam; flowery and fruity hoppiness; full-bodied, astringent and decently bitter; quite dry flowery hoppy finish; rounded

A blonde pils with a thin off white head. In aroma, pleasant hops, herbaceous, over grassy notes, clovers, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet biscuit malt ith fragrant hops, piney, citrus and floral, very nice. Bottle at Mondiale 2012, June 7 2012.

2012-06-08. Hazy sort of golden body, small white head. 3+ Mild aroma, lightly yeasty, lightly floral. Mild alcohol around the edges. 7+ Pleasant flavour, nice hops have a lemony grassy quality to them, modest bitterness throughout, sweet lemon candy in the aftertaste. 7+ Very smooth, average plus bodied palate. 3+ Enjoyable. I liked this better than I remember liking the Dogfish Head version. it would have been interesting to compare the two side by side. Bottle at Mondial, Montreal

Bottle ? ml  
Aroma sweet malts , honey , sweet flowers, soft front. Light hop hints, some black pepper.
 Appearance  cloudy gold with fine haze. Medium plus top. Thick layer of foam with good lace. 
Flavor and Palate : Soft, chewy , grainy , chalky. Alcohol well hidden. Hefy malt bottom. Sweet sided. Not very ESL like.

Bottle @ Rasmus place. Pours light golden with a white head. Aroma is light malty, fruity hops, pine. Taste is malt, nice bitter fruity hops, grapefruit, pine, some pepper in the background. Medium body, average carbonation, nice bitter finish. 240512

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2012 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours a perfect golden orange colour with a small dense white head. Lovely lacing all around. Nose is very citric with sticky an sweet caramel and light biscuit. Very pleasant aroma to this one. Taste is slightly resinous with citric hops (lots of orange and lemon), buttery biscuit and toffee. Full mouth feel and quite a lengthy bitterness. Very nice beer
Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and rather hoppy - fruity, citrus and spicy. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 240512
Bottle. Nice creamy head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, grass, fruits, citrus, peppery notes and malt. Nice mix of hops.

Bottle at Ølfestival 2012.
Hazy golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops and grapefruits.
Fruity flavour of hops, grapefruits and phenols.
Hoppy finish.

Bottle at Brass Monkey Leith. Nice hoppy aroma, citrus and pine with some grassy/hay and a little yeast. Taste is a little tutti fruity bubblegum, some grapefruit and pine with hay and yeast. Nice dry finish. Good

Bottel at DBF2012.
Hazy golden with a white head, some lacings. Aroma light malty (caramel, bread, honey), almost heavy hoppy (flowery, perfumy). Flavor light sweet, medium spicy. Medium body.
Pale yellow colour. Aroma is cirtusy and hoppy. Fresh, fruity taste. Flavour has a sweet and sour feel at first before becoming more bitter. Nice easy to drink beer.
Wholly different level, this one.  An IP and therefore a bit stickier on the mouth.  Long-lasting bitter aftertaste.  Shockingly abrasive nose.  Wow.

Sample at Ølfestival 2012. Hazy gold with a small white head. Impressively hoppy. Theres a sweet maltiness but its balanced out by the bitter floral hops. Nice. A big honey vibe too. Mouthfeel is pretty full and it goes down very easily. Very impressive stuff. Ill have to look out for more beers from Del Borgo and beers of this style.

750ml bottle poured into a snifter. Pours a lightly cloudy off-orange with about 4 fingers of thick white head. Aroma is very bready. Citrus, lemon and pepper. Taste is light bitter and very very lightly sweet. Citrus, bread and caramel with a touch of hay. Full bodied with a somewhat sticky texture. Fizzy carbonation and a very long finish. Overall, very good. I would gladly drink this again.

Sample from bottle, CBF 2012. Clear golden colour with a white head. Fruity aroma with hops, pines, peaches, passion fruits and caramel malts. Light sweet taste. Medium body with a creamy texture. Finishes bitter and fruity with grass, caramel malts, peaches and passion fruit. Excellent lager.

Bottle. Low fluffy white and quickly disappearing head. Hazy yellow body. Mild  fruity honey aroma. Flavor of fruits and a solid malt base in combination with notes of pepper. Low carbonation. Long aftertaste. Alcohold nicely subdued.
Bottle. Pours clear orange gold. Fluffy bone white head. Nose/taste of hay, lemon, pepper, citrus zest and bready malts. Finishes dry with some lemon and citrus zest. Medium body.

Bottle.  This is a pils?  Pours a mostly clear orange with a large white head.  Hoppy citrus aroma.  Flavor is smooth with a solid citrus hop bitterness well balanced by caramel malt.  Nice bitter finish.  Best pils Ive had to date.

ersma: continually hopped imperial pils, so stehts im untertitel. was soll das denn für ne sorte sein? zusammen mit dogfish head gebraut.
bräunlich, dunkel bernsteinfarben und trübe. oben ein riesen-berg feiner schaum, der ewig lange hält. selbst beim fast ausgefrunkenen glas schwimmt in der mitte noch ein dicker schaumboppel.

Bottle from Great Grog. Slightly hazy dark orange pour with a thick, frothy white head. Lovely musty nose, grass, apples, pepper, big lemon zest. Nicely clean and crisp with great juicy orange and lemon, some pepper and a nicely resinous bitter linger. This is lovely.

75cl bottle from Le Langhe in York. Opened with a bang and poured a slightly hazy, very light blonde colour with a thick white head. A musty aroma of saison yeast, lemon, pineapple, caramel and alcohol. Similar flavours with a dry finish, moderate carbonation and a chewy mouth-feel. Alcohol is quite prominent with great bitterness also. Lovely.

resin, golden, clear, very bitter, light body, bitter, 
Imperial Pils chiara di colore,molto profumata, fruttata e resinosa allo stesso tempo; il retrogusto che ti lascia è amaro, un amaro ricco...

Nice cloudy golden color with a tall white head. Has a nice floral hop scent and taste, has a fresher taste than the DFH alternative.

Hazy copper, big white head. Nose is hoppy, spicy, slightly bittersweet. Taste is slightly fruity, citric, finish has bready notes and a long bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, almost creamy.
Hoppy nose and palate. Fruit comes through nicely though it has a bitter aftertaste that lingers but not so long as to be overbearing. Nice beer.

Unaltra grande birra del birrificio del borgo! Bionda, schiuma super pannosa e persistente, aroma lupposo, sapore anche,non complessa ma molto bevibie e rinfrescante! Retrogusto deciso e persistente!

@ groove, Matera. Birra dal colore giallo non molto torbido. Cappello di schiuma persistente e pannoso. Allodore forti sentori di luppolo che si riconfermano al primo sorso. Retrogusto abbastanza amaro ma nel complesso una birra ben bilanciata

Una birra che merita davvero! Si presenta con un color giallo non molto torbido e una schiuma molto persistente. Al naso è molto floreale con sentori di frutta e agrumi. Il gusto è davvero eccellente ed immediato nel farci scoprire le sue caratteristiche. Good job Birra del Borgo!

Bottle shared by shigadeyo.  Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a medium sized creamy white head.  The aroma has a crisp hoppiness, mild fruit notes, herbal, resiny with pale malts.  The flavor has a sweet maltiness, yeast, mild fruits, some herbal and resiny hops.  This isjust not my style, but decent nonetheless.

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2012 Has a very Hoppy aroma similar to a pale ale but tastes similar to an Ipa. A little bit more bitter than the regular My Antonia. Wish I grabbed another bottle to compare with My Antonia.

Bottle, bought @ LIVA, Kolding. Clear, pale yellow with a big,  staying, creamy white head.  Aroma has pilsner malts, grassy, grapefruit, light vinious. Low to medium carbonation, dry and oily mouthfeel. Flavour has good hops,  grapefruit,  pine,  pilsner malts. Vinious, lingering bitterness.  Elegant,  but a bit sharp.

Big bottle, then draught at Bir & Fud. Big hop nose: citrus, grass, some pine. Light pilsner malt beneath. Clean, with just a tiny bit of caramel. Cloudy gold with a thick, lowish head. Flavors of sweet fruit and biscuits, light caramel, huge hops: citrus, sweet orange, apricot and, after time, apples. Comes out somewhere between a pils and an IPA. Thick and rich, refreshing and somewhat yeasty. I would bring up the pils malt character just a touch, but this is great. Very enjoyable.
Bottle. Color dark orrange with big white head. Aroma malt, hop, floral, citrus. Taste malt, hop, caramel, spicy, citrus.
Another well balanced beer from Birra del Borgo. Cloudy though - murky maybe - and a huge head that quickly starts to look like sewage foam.
drank this head-to-head with the Dogfish version.  Huge head on this one, nose was still hoppy but less flowers than the Dogfish counterpart; taste was slightly floral, but with more friut notes.

(75 cl bottle from Kervans; BBD: July 2013 Batch #95 11) Pours a pale, slightly hazy, golden with rich carbonation and a an extremely frothy, white head - its almost like pouring liquid foam directly from the bottle. Good retention and lace. I poured it in a tall glass so the aroma seems to have been contained somewhat by the head but I detect vague, floral, hoppy odours as well as something tart and some honey-like yeasty notes. The taste is a bit surprising though. Not much residual sweetness, some acidic and sour notes followed by a moderate bitterness. Oily texture, thin body and a long, bitter finish. I am not convinced this beer was supposed to smell or taste like this? I havent experienced any other beers from this brewery but the impression I got from this bottle was far from what Id expect a pale lager with American aroma hops to be like.. unfortunately a disappointment and at 13/bottle a rather expensive one.. girlfriend says: "Its quite strange. Very bitter but drinkable."

12/07/2011 Open Baladin Roma (tap). Ambrata, lievemente torbida, con buona schiuma morbida, bianchissima e abbastanza persistente. Al naso dimostra subito tutto il suo carattere. Intensamente luppolata, con note agrumate e di resina. Sensazioni confermate in bocca, la My Antonia stupisce per il suo carattere, pur rimanendo nel complesso davvero ben bilanciata. Corpo medio, carbonazione corretta. Una strong lager davvero sorprendente. Complimenti a Leonardo e a Sam!

375mL bottle.  ($7.99 / bottle.)  Golden color, a touch of haze.  Tall, foamy, white, frothy head.  Leaves sexy lace all down the neck of the glass.  Aroma of mixed berries.  Scent is wine like, resembles a Pinot Gris.  Flavor is sweet, fluid grains, light citrus effervescence, soft malts, gentle straw pils malts. Finishes with a straw character with grassy Saaz hops and a citrusy Simcoe presence.   Delicate, elegant,  and perfect in every way a beer could be.  The most well made beer Ive ever had.  So soft and divine.   Loads of fruit without fruit being used.  Amazing. (3251)

Gusher, pours dark copper, almost brown if not for the reddish hues.  Giant head, had to wait a while for it to settle down.  Nose is hay and grass, pine.  Taste is bittersweet, closer to sweet than bitter which I would expect the opposite in a Imperial Pils.  It does have a sharp bite at the end though.  Palate is smooth and creamy, aftertaste is average.

Capped 750 from Wine & Cheese in Clayton, Mo. Bottle is standard embossed Borgo and the label is sort of shield shaped. Pours hazy gold with champagne like bubbles and a creamy/frothy white head. Aroma is fruity and grassy. About med body. Its just a bit bready, and its thick with hop. So hoppy it is lush in the mouth. Mostly not harsh. So back to grassy and fruity, and some floral. A very nice drink. Recommended for those who enjoy lots of smooth hop. It finishes smooth and quite bitter.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2012 Deep golden color with rather large white frothy head. Nose is of what you would expect from a pilsner, something of a floral hop scent. Taste is Extremely similar to the nose, very floral.
Pours cloudy golden wih a modest off-white head and a floral aroma. There is a hearty pilsner malt flavor that sticks to the palate and an appropriate hop bitterness. This is a very nice pilsner.
UPDATED: FEB 6, 2012 Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours orange gold with a white head. Very citrusy and smooth amazing pilsner
Bottle shared with marcus. This is an awsome pilsner. Could drink it all day. Taste isnt complex but its what a good pilsner should be
I liked this version better then the Dogfish Head version.  It acted more like a nice dry hopped IPA for me even though its a Pilsner.  I liked this beer a lot and I hate Pilsners.
375 or 500ml bottle. Rating #180. This was a nice little surprise at an impromptu tasting. A little strange, spritzy and enjoyable with a nice little hop punch. (2146)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Bottle shared by shigadeyo. Poured a dark hazy amber color with an average to large frothy white head that was mostly lasting and produced excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy hops, malt and alcohol aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. Solid brew and very good for style.

Belmont bottle; the larger, fancy black variety. Fairly classic pour with a medium. bubbly white head that dissolved quickly. Really big aroma that is dominated by the Simcoe hops: sweetness at first and then some resin. Again the flavor is dominated by the hops but there is just enough malt to keep things balanced. I though this was really well done because sometimes this style is dominated by raw alcohol to me.

Lightly hazy, golden color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of toasted malts, citrus fruits, some floral hops, grass, toffee, and light alcohol.  Taste of toasty malts, more citrus, grass, light sweetness, but finishing fluffy, dry and crisp.

Aroma has notes of fresh juicy citrus-like hops, great for a pilsner. Pours light cloudy lemon in color with a big frothy white head. The flavor is certainly hops forward for a pilsner with light bitter and sweet hop notes at first, then drops with a bit of bitterness and settles like a refreshing crisp pilsner.

375 ml bottle into a tall pint glass. This is the Birra Del Borgo version with the badge shaped label. I have no idea what the vintage is, but it just popped up in a local beer store so it was either brewed again or B. United just released some more of the original batch.

A - Very nice amber/golden body. Slightly hazy with a large amount of carbonation rising from the etched glass bottom. Super fluffy 2 finger high white head that leaves a ton of lacing.

S - Very hop heavy. These hops smell very distinctively Dogfish Head. Tropical fruits and some light pine notes. This is followed by some subtle bready malts. 

T - Same as the nose. Tropical fruits, pine, and bready malts. There is a bit of grass and earthiness as well. Very bitter finish. Mouth feel is a bit on the light side, but sticky and oily.

O - Ive had the Delaware brewed version of this and I really dont detect too much of a difference. I am having a hard time distinguishing whether or not this is aged though. The hops are still very vibrant and there is a lot of fruitiness and bitterness, but this is balanced out by a great deal of mild malts. Overall a really nice collaboration. Glad I found the Italian version.
330ml bottle.  Pours a hazy orange with a large head.  Aroma is subtle, mango, banana with some grassy malt.  Taste has some straw to start.  Mango on the strong bitter finish.

24.5 ounce bottle.  Served in a pilsner glass, the beer pours a hazy golden/amber color with a couple inch frothy white head.  Head retention is excellent, and theres a good amount of lacing.  The brew smells like grassy and spicy hops, bready malt, and some light citrusy hops (lemon and orange peel).  It tastes like grassy, herbal and spicy hops, bready malt, lemon peel and some apples.  Theres a nice light bitter hoppy finish.  Mouthfeel/body is medium, its creamy, has soft carbonation and its easy enough to drink.  I think its a good brew, but at $14.99 a bottle Im not sure if Id buy it again at that price.  With that being said, its certainly worth trying.
Bottle. Unclear golden with big off-white head. Aroma is malt, hops, fruit and citrus. Flavour is malt, hops, citrus, medium sweet, grass, fruit, floral and bitter.

Tap. Lovely fruity sweet nose. Sweet without being cloying and not particularly bitter this is a nice drop. A bit of bubblegum, pineapple, some other bright flavours and you get a very happy beverage to welcome in the new year. Choice.
Very bitter, salty, old. Lots of flavor of cardboard, dusty wood and crates. Not very pleasant.

Bottle from Shawan Liquors. Pours dark yellow with a lot of cloudiness and an inch of white foam. It leaves lots of lacing in the glass. Faint hint of lemon on the nose. Lots of hop flavor on the tongue with a hint of bitterness. My favorite pilasters are the ones that dont hide their hops. The taste lingers a bit. Refreshing!

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2011 Bottle from Stirchley Wines, Birmingham. Rated using the automatic RB descriptors. Appearance: hazy, golden, white foam, minimal head.  Aroma: herbs, leaves, cooked vegetables, vanilla, raisin. Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter. Palate: medium body, thick feel, fizzy. Overall: a robust beer, with pleasant hops, fizzy, refreshing body, peppery malt and very drinkable quality. The rooty US hops are marked, with a strong US ale feel. Liked it.

375ml plastic-wrapped green bottle. The cap is weird and the plastic is hard to get off.

It pours a pretty clear gold with a nice white head that leaves nice lacing.

Well it smells orangey. It definitely doesnt smell like a pislener.

The flavor isnt bad either. Usually these imperial pilseners just end up tasting like sweet orange juice, this one actually tastes good, but more like an IPa. color me surprised. Nice bitterness, still some orange but also grassy herbal flavors. Not too much malt.

The imperial pilsener category is one of the worst beer styles known to man, but every once in awhile there is a decent one.
bottle thanks to Chris... need to have this side by side with the DFH version but if memory serves me I think this one is a touch sweeter, like it a bit better

375ml Bottle:  Aroma of malt, noble hops, slight grass, and slight citrus.  Poured amber/gold in color with a large, creamy, dense, foamy, off-white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Very sparkling.  Full of tiny-sized particles throughout.  Very good lacing.  Flavor is lightly sweet and lightly bitter.  Tastes of noble hops, Pils malts, and some dough.  Medium body.  Oily, then dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Pils malt and Noble hop finish.  7.5%ABV is completely hidden throughout.

slight haze, straw golden yellow. pillow-like, pure white head. good lacing, good pilsner malt aroma. very floral hop aroma and taste. slightly earthy and spicy. good balance. The hops are more spicy in this version compared to the straight DFH brew.
Bottle shared.  Slightly hazy golden pour.  Mild hop aroma. Flavour has hops and caramel.
UPDATED: AUG 6, 2012 33cl bottle shared with friends.Thin white head.  Pale golden pour.  Very nice brew.

Pours a nice golden color.  Huge foamy white head.  Smells very hoppy.  Taste is sweet!  With a nice balance of hops.  More sweet than bitter which is refreshing.  Tastes like an ipa though.  Delicious.

Appearance: Creamy white head, not very abundant, not very persistent. Amber hue, with golden shades, hazy.
Aroma: Intense, very hoppy, notes of resin and orange peel on the forefront, but also distinctive notes of pinapple and a little peach, a touch of spice.
Palate: Strong bitternes, nice body, even a little velvety Id say. Oranges and resin flavors pop back, long bitter finish with a touch of alcohol warmth. Good, but its a IPA, strikingly similar to some of Brewdogs stuff, not an imperial pilsener.

Rosemary, caraway, and possibly sage on the nose. Very herbal, but a nice combination. Clear yellow, thick puffy lacing head. Distinct sage flavor with a sweet hay base. Orange peel and perhaps lime zest too. Light body. Grassy finish. Im real hard on this style since there are so many bad examples available, but this is delicious.

Bottle of 33 cl. 7.5%. Perfect and persistent foam. The nose of fresh hops and herbal notes. In the mouth its like I imagined: the bitter and long is impressive. Despite this it still feels the sweet presence of malt. Great beer!

375 ml bottle from Wine and Cheese Place. Nice to see DFH anything in St. Louis, even if only because it was a collaboration brewed in Italy. Pours a cloudy yellow-gold color with a medium, even, fizzy white head. Aroma of grassy hops, faint citrus, hay, dry grains and cereal, and white bread dough. Flavor of grassy hops and herbs, citrus, melon and subtle tropical fruits, and crackers. Light-bodied, with a dry, crisp mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Really nice job with this style, which I normally dont like very much. Better than the one brewed at DFH for sure (which was also pretty strong for the style).

Bottle.  Pours clear dark gold with a large, creamy and frothy white head, long retention with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy Pilsener malt and Noble hops; clean lager character.  Flavor is moderate malt with medium, bitter spicy, earthy, and herbal hops, light fruit notes, a dry finish.  Medium body, warmth, and carbonation.

Hazy gold, attractive creamy white head.  Big citric hop nose, lots of pineapple.  Flavor is very lightly of pils malt, moving into a finish that is citric, touch of pine, floral and spicy - just a load of hops.  Interesting that the malt profile here doesnt seem to be quite as distinct as what I recall on the draft version I had at DFH.  But still a very enjoyable beer.  Same note that this isnt as "clean" as some may like in a pils.

Bottle pour thanks (DalzAle). Pours pale yellow gold with a creamy soapy white head that fades to a film. Aroma is hoppy and dry. Taste is more bittering hops and malt with some lemon citrus notes. Palate is full and chaulky and finishes dry.
Bottle.  Clear dark golden pour, little bit of carbonation and a light white pepper nose.  Flavor is light fruit, honey sweet and slightly spicy on the finish.  Decent.

Bottle...  Poured golden orange with a thick white head. Really solid, lovely hop floralness and bitterness. Sweet with malts for balance and a short, satisfying finish. Hints of honey, cereal grains, rye, tea leaves, grass, and tropical fruits.  Clean, smooth palate, and a decent amount of bitterness all the way through.

Pours hazy dark golden color with white head. Fruity aroma with citrus hops and bread dough. Very floral. Moderately sweet fruit flavor with some lemon and grapefruit and dough. Medium body with lively carbonation. I enjoyed this one much more than the one brewed at DFH.

12.7 oz bottle. Pours almost 100% flat.  No hiss when opening at all, no head and no noticeable carbonation bubbles.  Aroma of bready pilsner malt, great noble hop notes, spicy hops and citrus notes.  Flavor of tea, bready pilsner malt, spicy, citrusy and floral noble hops.  The no carbonation killed this beer.  For the money I paid...kinda ticked too. Maybe its just the bottle I had, but still...

Served on draft at The Birch in Norfolk, VA on 7/15/11. Pours a hazy golden color with a large creamy head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of caramel malts and leafy, citrus hops. The taste is bitter earthy and citrus hop notes with caramel and a faint bit of bread. Medium full bodied. Very tasty.

Very cool 12.7 oz bottle, that has Dogfish Head in big letters and the brewery and made in Italy in smaller ones.  Pours a cloudy gold with a fluffy head and aromas that are an interesting mix of hops (mango, citrus, a little grass and lemon)  with a light honey sweet maltiness.  Flavor is very nice... maybe a little more subtle than I was expecting, but still good.  I expected a hop tea of biting bitterness, but I get a honey and peach sweetness that plays nicely with the grassy, tropical fruit and light citrus (grapefruit comes to mind) of the hops.  Its light and airy on the palate and I would have pegged the ABV way lower than 7.5.  Mouthfeel is pretty silky for a light colored beer and finish is a nice mix of sweet and bitter.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Poured a nice straw color with a big white head. Aroma, sour grapefruit, hops with a small amount of hops. flavor slight bitterness, than he hops and some sweetness, citrus, bread light fruits, grapes. enjoyed this beer, I just wish it wasnt 6.99 a bottle I would buy more

Sampled from a 12.7 oz green bottle this beer poured a hazy yellow-golden color with a large fluffy white head that lingered and left some lacing. The aroma was somewhat skunked with a crisp spicy hop presence. The flavor was dry,t art and bitter with fairly strong lemon, spicy heat and a tangy pils undertone. The finish was long, dry and spicy. Medium body. Ok.

This time bottle, last time draft. Pours a hazy dark, amberish straw color. Pretty large white head. And tons of lacing left behind. Citrusy, grapefruit aroma. Some cereal (grapenuts) smell. Sweet and malty nose. Sweet and malty taste as well. Hoppy, but not overly so. A smooth balanced beer. I could drink it daily.
12.7 oz green bottle. Poured a slightly golden, pale copper color with a thick foamy white head. Aroma was light fruits, spices, hops. Flavor was a crisp, clean mild one.

Bottle. Hazy gold with a tall, thick, foamy blond head. Very hoppy and floral aroma atop grains, lemon, grass and soap. Taste is slightly spicy hops, grass, tropical fruit, orange, lemon zest, grains, sweet malt, light honey, and herbal notes. Body is medium with a dense, creamy carbonation. Ends with more lemony zest, grassy notes, herbal and floral hops, sweet malt, faint honey, sweet malt, and grains.

Draft at the Birch.  This is a big ol bowl of creamy goodness, light in color but big in character -- rich, fruity and delicious, maintaining its frothy breadth throughout an enjoyable 20 minutes.  (#4169, 7/13/2011)

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a forthy bright white head. Aroma is qutie hoppy with lots of citrus and peach, along with grapefruit and some sweeter citrus fruit and a grassy hop. The flavor is quite hoppy with grassy hops, grapefruit, peach citrus, orange and some sweet malty notes. The body medium with a dry mouthfeel. Overall a really nice Imperial Pils, with really nice hoppy notes.
Citrusy hop aromas.  Cirtusy hop flavors with good malt balance.  Is this really a pilsner?  Overall the best pilsner Ive ever tasted.

This was a splendid beer. When compared to the Dogfish head beer of the same name it extends way beyond. Fluffy and vibrant head with a nose of hops and bite. Good smooth taste though, just the right amount of alcohol.

12.7 oz bottle with black wrapper, 
this beer had a Gold, pink-red pour with a faint haze, the pour made a four finger or more white foamy head, effervescence is medium with a center stream that flows continuously, the bubbly head clung to the sides of the glass to provide nice lacing, there was a thin ring of sediment on the bottom of the bottle, 

this beer had aromas of grassy, floral and citrus hops with light bread malt in the background, the hops were certainly more out front than the malt, 

there were flavors of piney and citrus biting hops with a touch of herbs, bread and malt flavors in the background with some malt sweetness, 
the hops gave a good citrus, biting bitterness at the finish, 

the mouth feel was light, 

a hop forward beer with some malt, and gave a nice presentation.

375ml bottle from Sonoma Cellars Delavan.  Pours a deep yellow color with a big white head.  Aroma is mild, maybe yeasty, light malt.  Medium on the palate with soft carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, light malt, with a nice bitter hop finish. Pretty easy drinking for 7.5%.  Well see how it stands up to the DFH version.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2011 Pours a slightly hazy straw yellow with two fingers sticky white head. Nose is reminiscent of fresh cut grass with light citrusy notes. Very nice hop character at first but a mild astringency comes into play and lasts throughout the finish. Grassy and spicy with some citrus rind. Dry and crisp with a full hop bite.
Hazy golden yellow , white head. Arom aof caramel, loads of hops - pines, citrus, pineapple. Flavour adds nice grainy sweetness, some alcohol warmth. Bitter, thick, low carbonated.

This beer had a very nice colour for a strong pale lager. Smells and tasted quite fresh and hoppy, but not to an extreme. Fine mix between a nice blonde beer and an IPA or something. Refreshing goodness.

Bottle from Greens.  Clear golden pour with a pillowy white head.  Aroma was rich biscuity malts, hay, grass, and some earthy yet light citrusy hops.  Flavors were also quite earthy, lots of bready malt, grass, then a decent hop presence.  Quite nice.  Mouthfeel was somewhat fizzy yet quite smooth and robust.  Light bitter finish.  Quite good.

Bottle. 12.7 oz . (I think.) Picked up this little guy from Wine Works. Pour is quite impressive; massively cloudy straw yellow with a persistent white fluffy head. Aroma of sweet, buttery corn, floral hop resin, slight funk, lemon zest, and some tremendously nice pilsner malts. Medium bodied with a dry, yet soft and forgiving palate. Flavors of quite bitter hops, grapefruit, and some subtle oaky notes. Easy, smooth finish, with a small hop bite on the back of the tongue and a swell of pilsner malt warmth. This way better than the DFH version. Refined, restrained, and respectful. This one is dead center, and thus, dead on.
Not the best color Ive ever seen. Smell is very good though and taste certainly 8 points. Palate good.

750 ml bottle. Batch #LS131. From Rome, Italy. HHOK IX.
Hazy golden colour with average sized frothy white head.
Fruity hops, grapefruit, caramel, citrus, yeast and alcohol in delicious aroma.
Caramel, sweet hops, fruit, grapefruit, pine, citrus and yeast in ridiculously tasty flavour. Warming alcohol. I want more of this.

3 May 2011, bottle. pale yellow, faintly hazy, occasional bubbles, frothy white head. great nose! lots of hops. nose is passion fruit, some pink grapefruit, some astringent hop stems. thin body, fairly fizzy, slightly oily, crisp but not too much so. body is closer to lager than an ale but only just so. really nice! lemon gummy candy, passion fruit, some bitter grassy hops. if it wasnt for the body id swear this was a nice, hoppy pale ale. best lager ive ever had!

[355ml bottle courtesy of cgarvieuk] Brilliantly clear gold. Thin lacing. Wonderful dry, fruity aroma. Flowery. Mild carbonation. Rich fruity taste of pineapples and other sweet fruit, combined with a little grassy hop. Sweet, full aftertaste. Orange syrup? Really very nice indeed [15042011]
Bottle from the Cave. Hazy dark golden colour, white head. Aroma is fairly hopped, slightly malty. Flavour is hoppy, citrus, bit spicy. Slightly sweet and fairly dry finish. Very pleasant.

Bottled at Punavuoren Ahven, Helsinki. Poured orange brown in colour with white head. Fruity aroma, tropical fruits with yeasty aroma mostly. Flavour quite yeasty, a bit sweet and sticky. Also notes of tropical and dark fruits in flavour, very interesting combination. Smooth with a very pleasant sweetish aftertaste.

330ml bottle (Bacchanalia, Cambridge)
7 Wowsers, massively fruity aroma, extremely citrussy, and a bit piney.
4 Slightly hazy, and with huge head.
7 Massive fresh biting fruity hoppy taste. Some freezer ice joins the hops in the retronasals. Like Topopils, but even crisper. With more sediement in, it becomes more soapy, so I recommend keeping it clear and crisp. But dont think for one minute this is an easy quaffer, its not, its a very serious beer, and 330ml took 20 minutes or more.
4 Crisp palate, crisp carbonation. Lovely finish, sherbetty tingly fresh citrussy hops.
14 Stunning pils. Probably one of the top 5 pilseners Ive ever tasted. So much character, and made you want, nay crave, more. No sign of 7.5% anywhere. I would drink this until I fell over.
Buonissima lager iperluppolata ma assolutamente beverina, la migliore assaggiata allopen baladin.

On tap at Rustico. Reviewed from notes.

Pours a light copper with a white head and some good, sticky lacing on the way down. Nose hits like an imperial pilsner with a bit more, as in addition to some grain and bread I got a bit of caramel as well, though it was fairly slight. Some European hops thrown in there as well. The taste balances everything quite well and it does taste like an amped up pilsner. Feel is light to medium with good carbonation. A very nice collaboration.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 10-15-2010

Esperimento riuscito. Questa imperial Pils non delude,anzi. Sicuramente allinizio può spiazzare, ma è una birra piena di sapore, amara(forse eccessivamente) che si va bere nonostante la gradazione alcolica elevata.

Bottle from myBrewerytap.com
Hazy blond, lively, fluffy head. Peaches and cram, sour finish. Very Belgian, very American, quite Italian. Long complex sour finish with sour grapes. PAae lager? Hardly.

Bottle 750 ml EXP 08 2012 shared with JanneK Thanks. Colour golden yellow ,white lacing scent:fruity. Aroma:grapefruity pineapple hoppy first decent  bitterness in aftertaste. alcohol hidden under hops. Good one more please

Draught at Open Baladin, Rome. 
Clear golden with a medium-sized white head. Sweet malty aroma, with slight caramel and a dash of peppery alcohol. Sweet malty with citrus notes in flavour with intense hop bitterness from start to finish. Both sweet and bitter contribute to a big beer.

On bottle at bir&fud. Very fragrant with floral and resin feelings well balancing together. Honey taste and a little bit hopped, has a very intense initial taste with a bitter finish. I didnt feel the 7.5% alcoholic graduation too much. Drinkable enough.

Color dorato scuro con fine schiuma che rimane persistente. Al naso risultano subito le varietà di luppoli utilizzati. Aroma molto fresco, intenso agrumato ( cedro), e sentori delicati floreali. Anche in bocca è il luppolo padrone assoluto, decisamente ancora dagrumi, il gusto è forte, aspro forse un poco estremo, ma a me garba parecchio. Il finale secco, persistente e amaro richiama subito il nuovo sorso. Ottimo esperimento

Extreme pils, the masterpiece of the brewery. It was made with Dogfish. Taste: Hops, citrus, spices. The body is obviously low. Complex taste,with an amazing long end. Clearly underrated, compared with beeradvocate ratings.

vado controcorrente. magari era la bottiglia sbagliata. in ogni caso laspetto è perfetto, bel colore biondo limpido e schiuma pannosa. Laroma è erbaceo e niente di più. In bocca è di corpo esile e lamaro è molto estremo con un gusto che ricorda la menta e eucalipto. Monocorde.
Very hoppy aroma, very fruity and citrusy... what a character! Taste is also dominated by hops.
33 cl bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a white head. The aroma is grain with hops and citrus notes. The flavor is pretty similar, with a bitter finish. Medium body with medium carbonation.
33cl bottle. Take a very good american IPA, change color from gold to yellow, change body from medium-full to medium-light and you have my antonia. Cara pils effects. Still gorgeous.
It seems more like an IPA an over-hops beer. Citrus notes are evident but the bitterness is not perturbing taste. Quite drinkable indeed.

A nice clean strong beer with punchy mouth-filling hoppiness. Aroma is fruity and hoppy. Bitterness is high and finish long. Some sweetness lurks behind the bitterness and thickens the body. 33 cl bottle from Eataly Bologna, BB 06 2012.
Bottle 33 cl (best before 09 / 2012). Hazy golden almost light amber color and vanishing head. Grassy and citrusy nose. Very light body, dry and bitter end.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2011 Taps @ Open Baladin Rome: What a surprise! Imperial pils with an incredible aroma and flavour of hops, citrus, honey and resin! Se qualcuno te la mettesse sotto il naso e te la facesse annusare ad occhi chiusi, la scambieresti per una versione estrema della ReAle Extra. Poi la assaggi, apri gli occhi e...

Mi accodo a Corkscrew: mai avrei detto che era a bassa. Comunque il luppolo utilizzato ha piallato tutto, quindi era pure comprensibile non arrivarci. Buona comunque, anche se il carattere da pils dovrebbe emergere di più

Pils? ma dai? non avrei mai detto che fosse a bassa. Luppolo domina con note erbacee decise ed avvolgenti; bene, Birra del Borgo è il regno degli USA Made in Italy. Lasciamole fare a loro queste birre straluppolate.

Bottle. Hazy golden with huge head. Distinctive aroma with a lot going on, clean hops and lemon being most notable. Medium to fll bodies with frothy creamy carbonation. Flavour starts with a balance of sweet malts, tangy fruits and hops and quickly transitions to strong and long lasting bitter finish. An excellent bitter beer.

On tap at Capital Ale House - Downtown on 04/04/2010. Im guessing this is the Birra del Borgo version, since apparently VA has label approval for both version on tap, but the DFH version didnt receive approval until 05/12/2010. Slightly hazy golden body with a small off-white head. Sweet floral and noble hop aroma. Sweet noble hop flavor with some pilsener malt. Medium body with moderate carbonation.

Bottled. A hazy golden beer with a rocky off-white head. The aroma has notes of malt and clean, spizy Saaz. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, caramel, grapes, and spicy hops - a mixture of Saaz and Pacific NW hops. Thanks yespr for sharing.

Bottle. Pours golden with an orange tint and a medium white head. Aroma is hops, florals, and citrus. Flavor is sharp but not overpowering bitterness with nice floral, citrus, and honey notes. Medium mouthfeel and some nice heat (heat in a pilsner!?). I really like this beer alot...Im not completely sure why...maybe its because so many bitter beers are starting to blend together...and the excessive use of pilsner hops is new to me...Whatever it is...I love it.

Rich gold pour, creamy white head.  Citrus, resin, and some light unripe stone fruit.  Flavor starts off with a bit of pale malt and quickly turns to the resin and citrus hops.  Nice hoppy pils.  Very good.

Bottle.  Poured a light clear golden color with a tall dense white head.  Big citrus/floral hop notes in the nose, light grass, pale malt, and alcohol.  Soft carbonation with a somewhat oily mouth feel.  Flavor is much what I expected, an over hopped pilsner.  Mostly sweet, loads of citrus and grass with lesser notes grain, pale malt, and toffee.  Good amount of balancing bitterness in the finish.

Crystal clear 14 karat pour produced a 1/2 inch ivory head that left significant webs of lacing.  Aroma shows citrus, lemongrass, spice, yeast, and black pepper.  Definitely has a hot peppery quality accompanied by tangerine and hay...yes, chewing on freshly cut grass would hit the palate similarly.  A bit prickly but very different...liked it!! !

Bottle. Moderate malt aroma of grain, herbs and dried grass for the hops, mustiness for the yeast with a background note of pepper. Head is large, frothy/foamy with good thick lacing and is fully lasting. Color is crystal clear gold. Flavor starts lightly sweet and lightly to moderately acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and moderately bitter. Palate is medium, watery with a carbonation between lively and fizzy and a dry finish. Basic aroma but excellent in interpretation of the style. This is an excellent version of an Imperial Pils.

Bottle from SL. Poured a straw golden color with a big pillowy white colored head that just mushroomed a crown that was awesome. The aroma was grains and strong saaz grass hops. The flavor featured strong pilsy malts, grains, strong grassy hops, excellent spicey hops, strongly hopped overall. This paired fantastically with some mildly spicey tacos and guacamole, the alcohol drawn out a bit more probably because of the food. Mouthfeel was well carbonated and full bodied. A very nice DFH brew.

(750ml bottle thanks to Sammer) opaque yellow with lasting film of white bubbles. Nose is floral, yeast and citrus. Taste of rye bread, oranges, bitter orange peel, with soft carbonation and bitter linger.

Tap @ Ebenezers , Slightly hazy , light golden pour, huge white head ,excellent lacing. Aroma of citrus , pine and grass. Sweet malt and fruit notes , touch of lemon rind . Light bodied , dry lingering bitter finish .

Bottle. Nice bright white head that slowly disintegrates. Subtle aroma of floral hops, some ginger, herbs, faint cinnamon, a little citrus. Nice mouthfeel, robust but not creamy or thick. Flavor hoppy, nice spicy pepper, crisp, clean, pronounced citrusy sweetness up front with lasting bitterness in back. Little bit soapy. Plenty of carbonation. Its a pilsener. The imperial part is maybe a bit of a marketing sleight of hand.

Bottle thanks to Sammer.  
Smells alcoholic, tastes bitter, orange peel and basil.  Pretty good!

750 mL bottle from Total Wine in Raleigh (North Hills location).  Golden orange pour with a thick and creamy off-white head.  Aroma of roses and wet grass.  The flavor actually does remind me of a pilsner unlike some other beers I have tried in this category, but there is a nice amount of floral hop bitterness to please my palate.  I was expecting something more along the lines of Golden Era (it doesnt quite live up to that standard) but this is certainly a different beer.  This is quite good.
Bottle from drowland organized tasting @ Proof on 7/23/10.  Hazy yellow pour.  Sweet candy sugar and lemon aroma.  Tastes are light spice, honey, malt and citrus zest.  Clean and crisp.  Dry finish.

Im a sucker for simcoes and didnt realize how they could add a nice spicy kick to a solid pilsner with a solid malt foundation. I had this on tap at the Rehoboth brewpub (My Antonia). I only had a sample but this one really delighted me as a combo hophead and malthead.
Golden pour with very little head.  Nose is pears and sugar.  Taste is  hoppy, somewhat spicy and dry.  Finish is bitter, yet a bit of sweetness remains.  A nice contrast of spicy and sweet flavors.

Not your fathers pilsner. A big robust beer much in contrast with the regular pilsners. Pours as you would expect with a straw yellow and a big fluffy head that lasts and lasts. Taste is again bold with a distinct hop profile that lends a very nice long lasting after taste. Another winner from Dogfish Head.

750 ML bottle from Pinocchios into a Pilsener glass. Pours a lemon color with a small head that gradually diminishes into a coating. Lacing is thin but lasts throughout. Nose is some citrus and herbal hops, grassy notes and some nuttiness. Taste is lemongrass, citrus, bready malt, and some honey. There is some nice bitterness in the end but sweetness is what you are left with. Mouthfeel is on the lighter side of medium, creamy and ample carbonation. You notice the alcohol but it is something that adds rather than detract. This is really refreshing and something I would seek out again.

750 ml bottle.  Pours a slightly cloudy golden honey with a thick and fluffy large sized off white head.  Aroma of various hops, faint citrus and yeast.  Taste of hops, light citrus, yeast and faint honey.  A nice refreshing brew, yet pricey as usual from DFH.
750ml bottle. Pours gold/orange, with a very large, white head. Aroma is subdued, with grapefruit hops, other citrus, and some sugar. Flavor is hops, sugar, fruit, and alcohol.

Thanks kiefdog for the share.  Pours clear gold with a foamy as hell white head.  Nose is some malt, hops, a bit of light yeast, but nowhere near the  level of a lager that I am used to.  It has the bitterness if a pils, but not the yeast bite or mouthfeel.  It is a great beer, but not my idea of a pils.

The aroma is not that sweet but it does have malt. It is mostly dominated by grass and herbal hops. The appearance is golden with a large head. The taste is like the aroma with an astringent finish. The palate is smooth. Overall I am not in love with this but its not bad.
very good beer, strong flavors of malt and hops. the beer is smooth at the beginning then hits you hard at the end. golden malt makes this a nice beer for a fine meal.
Slightly cloudy light golden color.  Aroma is of hops, pepper, smoke, and leather.  Flavor is full of earthy hops, spices, pepper, and caramel.  Leaves a nice hop finish.  Yum

Tap at DFH Rehoboth Beach. Poured a slight hazy yellow with no head and no lace. Nose is sticky sweet candy, artificial orange flavor, slight diacetyl. Taste is drying hops, bland, sticky candy. Bleh. Everyone else must be drinking something different.
Draft at DFH Rehoboth Beach.  Hazy golden color, edge head, moderate lacing.  Aroma of lemon and caramel.  Taste is grass, straw, hop profile more like an IPA than a lager.  Interesting.

Clear yellow orange in color...Citrus, sweet aroma, alcohol apparent... Flavor is not overly bitter, nice crispness with some citrus sweetness, bitterness definitely comes out on the finish... Really nice imperial pilsner...

Has a very thick  head and sweet subtle aromas. I was able to detect bitter hops and barely. It seemed very fizzy which probably had a lot to do with the carbonation, which was pretty spot on. The flavor were subtle and bitter, but enjoyable none the less.

750 mL bottle.
A: Pours a clear golden with a one finger white head that retains lacing throughout.
S: Smells of crisp hops and light citrus.
T: Familiar, crisp pilsner malt taste with a slightly creamy finish.
M: High carbonation and medium body.
D: Quite palatable and the unexpected creaminess was a pleasant surprise.

Clear golden color/ lasting white head. Big ass fresh, spicy earthy hop aromas with pils malt. light frothy mouthfeel.  Good pale malt, corn flakes flavors with pungent, spicy euro hops, very fresh tasting, very good.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: on tap.buona pils con sentori di malto e resina. al gusto si percepisce ancora malto, grano e resina. finale molto amaro e secco. equilibrata.

Very large pillowy bright white head of very small bubbles.  Excellent carbonation.  Light and grainy aroma with some biscuit malts, cereal grains and some lemon grass.  Color is a medium golden orange.  Nice hoppy flavor with some orange peel, bitter piney hops, more grains and dried flowers.  Very bitter with a bit of chalky dryness. Light alcohol presence.  Pretty easy drinking once you get passed the bitterness.  Finishes dry with a lingering pasty bitterness.  A pretty good pilsner but not your average run of the mill stuff.

Hazy golden color, frothy head and good lacing.  Sweet pilsner malty aroma and flavor backbone with a strange hoppy flavor that just didnt seem to fit the style (from the description I figured it was the simcoe).  Tart zingy finish.  Good but not great.
Gold with a big white head.  Aroma is spicy, floral, and citrusy, and taste is the same, with a mildly grassy finish.  $8/750
Bottle split with pat. Pours a yellow gold with very slight head. Aroma is spicy and tame. Mouthfeel is smooth, not too much going on but definitely great session potential.

Draught at Coles, Buffalo, NY. Pours a clear yellow-gold with an average size diminishing white head. Lovely aroma of grassy hops, fruit, some honey and caramel malt. Flavour tastes like an extra-hoppy Pilsener with a long bitter finish. Quite tasty and so easy to drink. The alcohol is very well hidden. Medium bodied. Great stuff, Id love to buy bottles of this.

On tap at Open Baladin. Clear golden with a medium white head. The aroma is quite hoppy with notes of pine, peach, passion fruit and caramel. The flavour is grass, caramel, peach, passion fruit, mango and rest sugar. Very nice and clean.
Draught @ Open Baladin. Pours unclear golden with a small creamy white head and lacings. Nose is sweet and fruity. A bit of alcohol, caramel and peach. Peach melba butter . . unclean Tap perhaps?
herbs, citrus, golden, clear, very bitter. Wonderful!!!!!!
Draught at Open Baladin. Clear golden - white head. Nice bitterness. Nice hoppy. White bread. Zesty. Lovely.

Draught at Bir & Fud, Roma. Clear golden with a huge white head. Aroma of flower, malt and light spice/peppery notes. Flavour is extremely clean - crisp malt, citrus, spice. Dry and refreshing finish. Dangerously drinkable - so much I needed a few glasses for my fix. A great collabo brew.
Dense snowy cap over goldy yellow coat. Has very sweet flowery top note of jasmine and rose, gorgeous smooth hop profile, some grape and truffle. Beyond lager.
A different take on this style.  On tap at Coles, who brought it in again.  Golden with a thick white head, that leaves lots of lace.  I liked the hops, but still not that drinkable.Neutral aroma.

Bottle. My first from this Italian micro.The Dogfish head logo on the bottle caught my eye and I wasnt dissapointed. Golden with a medium head.Hoppy with a lingering aftertaste  leaving you wanting more. Would class it as an IPA rather than a lager.No matter what you call it it isan excellent drink.

Draught.  At Coles, Buffalo NY, May 14, 2010.    Pours a clear slightly copper-tinted gold with a smallish white head.  The aroma is pungently floral/herbal, slightly sweet, you certainly can detect some alcohol in the nose;  dry.  Taste - very very nice - thick and chewy light-tasting grainy malt up front, with a huge hit of dry grapefruit pith / zesty hop bitterness that grabs your attention and distracts your palate from the definitely > 7% ABV - damn I liked this.  Had a thick, chewy mouthfeel, with solid carbonation and a long bitter citrus finish .... wow - malty enough this is a German pils, but hoppy enough for any north american beer geek hophead.  Mmmmmmm.

Bottle from Kris Wines, shared with Slothez. Hazy yellow pour with a healthily plump white head. Fragrant hop and fresh citrus aplenty in the nose. Clean and very tasty flavour that had more of the same, with a touch of herbiness. Decent balance thanks to some lurking sweet malt. Dryish bitter finish. An interesting and quality collaboration.
Massive floral hop aroma.  Flavor is an interesting hop bomb with notes of yellow fruit.  There is a particular light note of banana skin that is a bit odd, but all in all, this is a very good beer.

Tap @ Coles.  GOld with a thin head.  Nose is awesome grassy & spicy hops, great lightly caramelized malt.  Flavor is hoppy - bitter, grassy, lemon/orange hops.  A bit of honey maltiness.  Long grassy bitter toasted malt finish.

On tap at Coles. Appearance: golden orange with a small whispy white head. Aroma: nicely hoppy with hints of pineapple, yeast & corriander. Nice. Flavour: Initially quite hoppy, bitter with lots of yeast and a resounding pine-ness, lovely juicy mouthfeel. Delicious long bitter finish.
Light yellow in color. Foam recedes but really sticks to the glass. Medium hop bite that fades gracefully into traditional pilsner taste. A little tinnyness and sone fruit notes
I had this on tap at Beachwood BBQs Italian Beer Festival. This yellow pour has some maltiness up front and and a dry bitter finish.

Draft at Coles, Buffalo NY. Deeper yellow/gold pour. Aromas of saaz hops & malts. Taste is consirably hoppier than most pilsners. Not a one dimensional European hop flavor either. Definately some DFH influence here. Solid bitterness. 7.5% is well represented here. Very good Pilsner

On tap at Rusticos Alexandria. Dark gold pour, nice off-white head. spicy, fruity nose. Odd, hard-candy-like fruitiness up front with a nicely bitter finish. Interesting, but I dont think Id drink more than one.

Draft at redlight redlight.  Pours a cloudy gold, white head with minimal lace.  Grassy hoppy nose with hints of bright malts and roasted corn and wild flowers.  The flavor has a candy, bubblegum sweetness up front but finishes with a bold bitterness.  Well balanced and a pretty tasty beer.

Light golden pour with a frothy white head.  Mouthfeel is bizarrely creamy with an almost whipped feel.  Olives, lightly bitter hops, lemon rind in the aroma.  Flavor is yeasty, with lemon and a bit of bitter hops and light floral flavor.  Oily, with a Dry finish.  Interesting but pleasant

Draft Mostly clear, light golden ale with a small, creamy, white head. The bouquet is of pilsner malt, toffee and sharp, spicy, earthy hops. Full-bodied  and a touch oily with busy carbonation. Leans on the bitter side of balance -  very nice, sharp hop bite. Finishes bitter and dry.

Sampled on tap at Church Key DC 10/22/09: Pours a hazy pale golden with an airy pillowy white head.  Has a sweet pale malty nose with some fresh grapefruity grassy hops and a touch of light fruiity floral notes.  Starts with good fullness and sweet biscuity pale maltiness with a nice balance of resiny citrusy hops and crisp bitterness before a drier bittersweet finish.  Pretty well-balanced and true to style.

Tap @ Blind Tiger.  Poured crystal clear light gold color with an off-white head.  Buttery diacetyl aroma.  Grassy and bready malt notes.  The flavor was light and full of bitterness to the point of almost being astringent.  The mouthfeel was very slippery from the diacetyl.  Light-medium bodied.  Dry with a very long very big bitterness.  Not my cup of tea.

Draft. Clear, pale golden pour. Minimal, white head. The aroma has notes of hay, toasted grain, honey. Hints of grass, lemon, bread. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. It finishes lightly sweet and moderately bitter. Medium body, velvety texture, moderate carbonation. The maltiness sticks around through the finish overriding the hop notes, not unexpected in a strong lager. No problem drinking this. Unique with a fine balance.

A clear golden colored beer with a thick foamy white head. The aroma of hop bitter with fruits lik citrus and a little spices. The taste is bitte with fresh fruits like citrus some spices and caramel. The aftertaste is long bitter with some sweets.

Pours a mostly clear golden with a thin white head.  Aroma is sweet yet buttery with some DMS, honey laden big toasty pale malts, bready, big to the point of being sharp- vanilla and earth hints.  Flavor is vanilla creme filling in a donut, big toasty sharp pale malts, honey sweet, DMS is mod to light- gets a touch slick, some earthy and slightly weedy grassy hops, resin, raw harsh bitter finish and not that clean or refined overall- meh.

Draft at Redlight Redlight.  Pours a crystal clear, medium golden hue.  Effervescing bubbles stream towards the surface, pooling into a small, foamy, off-white head.  Solid sheets of micro-film lacing provide full coverage on the glass.  Aromas kick off with notes of sweet, clean cereal grain, hay, bread, and a hint of honey.  Softly grassy hops provide the counterpoint.  Flavors are a bit sweeter than I care for in a pils, no doubt due to the hefty grain, bread, and dough malt notes.  Though its hoppy, the grassy, lemony bitterness fails to catch up to the malty sweetness.  Accordingly, the palate is just a bit overly hefty, lacking the fresh crispness that I was hoping for. Pils is a style best left "small" in my opinion.  The "imperial" versions rarely live up to expectations, and this one is no exception.  Still, its a pretty decent brew, and they showed a little restraint in that they could have certainly beefed it up even more.
Draft @ Blind Tiger. Golden pour with white head. Grainy malt, damp basement and yeast aromas. Flavor was mish mash: earthy, citrus, skunky sour. Eck.

Had on draft at Thirsty Monk in Asheville. Pretty intense aromatics, nutty notes, bright and fresh. The body is fairly light, not to say it is lacking in flavor. or intensity. Very crisp, bitter, extremely dry style. Finish leaves a bit to be desired, drops off rather quickly. Pleasant, though a bit pricy. ($7.50)
Leonardo in collaborazione con il dogfish head hanno creato questa imperial pils veramente buona!! frescha luppolatura e un bel maltato morbido... birra molto erbacea e beverina! mitika!

Draught pour from The Thirsty Monk in Asheville.  This beer took me by surprise.  Clear yellow pour with white head.  Nose of lovely Saaz hops, and I swear Hallertau.  Very plisner-like, spicey and grassy and floral but also fruity... like some exotic fruit Ive never had before.  This was a really unique beer to me, and I enjoyed it immensely.  Would love to seek out more of this style or see more of it.  I doubt it would bottle very well (or for very long).  Yum.

Cask at the White Horse Old Ale Festival, 27th Nov 09. Hazy amber. Fresh North American hop aroma. NA hops on the initial taste too but the palate drops off nearly instantly and doesnt retain the flavour.
Bottle at Craigs house. A nice beer with a nice name. Pale golden colour. Delicate flavours.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2011 Bottle at home from GBBF. With my Mate Stephen... and even though i shared my My Antonia .... he refused to share his wife Antonia... hazy yellow .... short lived big white head ... colapsing to a light foam covering ... soft zezty fruity hop ... lemon and pine nose .... sweet pine hop .... very piney ... much more an ipa than a lager ... juicy ... big and bold ... really tasty and balanced ... 
bottle at home ... copper ... sweet juicy fruit hop nose ... zezty fruity pine hop ... soft toffee malts ...

Very pale golden pour.  The nose is quite sweet with lots of sweet malt character.  A little bit of honey and herbal malt character as well.  Lightly grassy nose behind the sweetish malts.  It is very hoppy on the palate with a very assertive bitterness.  Its really kind of a mess.  Some nice aromatics but theyre clobbered by being too boozy, too bitter and just too much.
Tap at Redlight. Big pillowy white head, light gold body. Huge hop aroma, very aggressive. Nice clean lager profile with a big hop bitterness. Very good.

(Cask, by gravity, at White Horse, Parsons Green, London, 29 Nov 2009) Hazy copper colour with frothy, white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with grapefruit, resin and pine needles. Fruity, hoppy taste with notes of grapefruit, resin and pine needles. Rather sweet with intense hop flavours. Full body, chewy mouthfeel. Slightly over the top and hardly very well balanced, but still a very tasty beer with an impressive hop presence. Nice one.
Golden with a big and lasting white head. Rich herbal and spicy hop aroma with a faint citrus note. Intense spicy and pine hoppy flavour with a somehat weak malt background.

Bottle.  Golden with a large off-white foam.  Aromas are caramel with spiced oranges.  Yeasty with lemon sherbet.  Floral, hoppy and clean.  Flavours are sweet oranges with green pine.  Very floral with sticky caramel.  Some pineapple.  Warming peppery alcohol on the finish.

Bright golden body with a small head. Aroma is bitter, pine and grapefruit. Slick mouthfeel, flavor is mostly pine and cat pee hops with some bitter grapefruit. Lingering bitter finish, fresh grass and cat pee.

draft @ redlight redlight.  Bready honey aromas with spicy earthy hops on the nose.  Pours golden blonde with a thick white head, bubbles slowly cascading to the surface.  Honey malts, bready malts flavors, and spicy bitter hops, a little sweet but otherwise a solid pilsner.

Ive been a bit disappointed by colaborrations in general and with DFH being involved...I mean, I like Dogfish Head, but lets just say I was skeptical. That said, this was really good, bordering on awesome. Light and crisp, completely hiding its strength. Lots herbal, piney hops, and light, mildly corn flavored malt base. Very drinkable, very enjoyable.

Hazy gold with a big, loose white head.  Big, zesty hopping, lemon and grapefruit.  Smooth, the hops convey all their wonderful flavour without drying you out too much.  Perfectly balanced.  Loads of honey in there too. Very awesome.

Draft.  Pours a golden body with a white head.  Dingy malt aroma and grain, almost a bit like line build up or mildew ridden malt.  Citrus, and vinegar but not in an enjoyable manner.  Slightly better flavor, citrus, dingy socks, grass y earth toned with a dry finish.  Not a fan.

From the Bottle at Chris Os 06/08/2009
Hoppy aroma. Golden coloured very hazy in appearance and hoppy. Strong in alcohol with a little dryness in a bitter malt finish.

Bottle.  Vibrant golden beer with a very strong white head.  The aroma is vinous , yeasty and spiced, and the flavour is vinous, bitter and spiced.  Overall a nice, vinous, spiced and bitter flavoured beer.

Bottle at Bière Mondial 2009, Strasbourg. Pours a pale clear yellow with a white head. Lots of hops aromas. Simco? Some malt aromas. Full bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry finish. Very much like Mikkeller Draft Bear.
On tap at Churchkey DC.  Hazy yellow with a frothy white head.  Citrus aroma, grassy, slightly boozy.  Flavor is perfumy, sweet, sugary, grassy.  Sticky finish thats drinkable.

(draft) Cloudy straw body with rocky white head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, straw, grapefruit, peach, light herb/straw.  Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit, peach, light pineapple.  Medium body, low carbonation.

A Mes rate. Bottle at GBBF.Darkish orange gold with an excellent pillowy white head that lasts really well. Woo hooo bring on the Simcoe. Faint sweet malty backbone is just about detectable in the midst of all this hoppage but its just providing a back beat. Proper complex hoppage. The Saaz and Simcoe work really well together. Alcohol is hidden well and the nice dry bitterness in the finish makes it very drinkable indeed. Damn good stuff.

Bottled 750ml. -Yellow/orange coloured, big white head, lively carbonation, also fruity nose with hint of hops like Trentatre Ambrata. Sweet malty and fruity with pleasant hoppy notes. Bitter finish, but all in all something is missing.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with ogivlado (thanks!) Poured a huge thick chalky white head that went away very very slowly. Slightly hazy golden colour. Fruity sweet aroma hop in the nose, a bit malty. Sweet malty taste, some weak fruity aroma hop bitterness, a bit soapy. Strong bitter aftertaste. Nice hop profile but not all that refreshing and almost dull. Some light alcohol too. Pales in comparison with the two Trentatre beers weve had before this.

Bottle 345ml.Clear medium to dark yellow color with a huge, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, heavy hoppy, flowers, grapefruit, citrus. Flavor is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a average to long duration, and a dry finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20090806]

Bottle @ Vilvordia Bierproef Festival, Jette, Brussels. Pours a little hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity grassy citrus hoppy aroma with some hints of grapefruit. Sweetish malty grainy hoppy bitter citrus and grapefruit flavor. Has a sweetish hoppy bitter finish with a long bitter aftertaste.

Bottle from GBBF 2009. Pours a cloudy orange with a huge head which gradually dissipates after a minute or so. Citrus, peach, light spice aroma. initial taste reminds me of orange marmalade! Theres also a nice hoppy texture and finishes bitter/sweet.

Bottled (at ChrisO, BB 09/2010). 
Hazy yellow color, big cloudy white head, lots of lace. Strong cut grass aroma in the nose. Sweetish background, fresh grassy, lemony hops, some "cat pee" too. Interesting and no wonder that DFH brewer has brewed this, there is similarities to some DFH products.
Bottled. Hazy amber colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is soap, perfume, some grass as well. Flavour is caramel malts, toffee, some fruity and grassy notes. Yet very wellbalanced.
Bottle from GBBF 09. Hazy golden with a big head. Nice grassy hop aroma, hints of yeast. Complex hop flavours: grass, citrus, herbs, all very dry. Full-bodied, fizzy. Refreshing and complex.

As stated by others, this beer had a hazy appearance with medium to smallish head. Tasted a lot of citrus and spice. The hops take a back seat to the rest of the ingredients. The balance was nice and it makes for a very refreshing summer beer.

Good toffee flavor, and malt, rich, with just the required sweetness; strong and aromatic hopping, a bit citrusy. The final is strong and long. The aroma is a bit fruity, resiny, sweet, flowery. Good body strength, toffee and malt flavor, with a very good hopping, sweetish, fruity and resiny, creamy. Really good.

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Hazy golden with a dense white head leaving some laces. Fresh, citrusy nose. Surprisingly light-bodied - almost a little watery - sweetish fruit and malt with very fresh hop accents leaving a distinct bitterness. 260309

25.04.09 @ VBPF, Jette.
Hazy golden color, with small off-white head.
Aroma malts, hops, spice.
Medium body.
Taste very good. Hops, malts, nice amercan bitterness. Finish = dry.
GREAT.

Good head, white, fully hazy golden beer with verdigris shine. Nice C-hops, obviously USA, dry hopbales. Dry, hoppy, restrained grassy and some lunaria - more IPA really than Pilsener. Fully hop-determined palate, but the finish releases some sweet malts. Medium bodied, typical gristslickness. Good, quite good even, but as said, this has the character of an IPA, rather than a Pilsener. The use of bottom fermenting, and a bit of Saaz wont change that.

Draught, 7%. Distinctly grassy hop aroma. Cloudy amber colour. Stable creamy off-white head. The flavour is a quite rough hoppiness, very grassy and quite bitter. There is a little sweetness to balance, and the mouthfeel is OK. The bitterness gets a bit much for me after a while. 5 3 5 3 12

Draught. New sample, different place. The aroma still has some veg, seems to me that something went wrong during hopping. The flavour is better though, nice and caramelly with a distinct but not rough alcohol flavour. 5 3 6 3 14

From tap at Bir and Fud. Pours almost clear golden orange with a lasting and creamy white head. Aroma is peachy, citrusy and grapefruity, solid hoppy. Flavour has the same with a complimenting light caramel malt base. Full bodied. Smooth and flavourfull/bitter finish.
Clear golden with a white fading head. Nose is dominated by hops, with citric, herbal and spicy notes. Not that elegant anyhow, with a cabbage note. Very dry and bitter, resinous, medium bodied.
